div.p: A Voyce from the TEMPLE.

The word of GOD, the covenant of Light, doth discover and declare the Anabaptist so called, to be in the reprobate state, and one of those many heads and horns of the Beast which are sprung out of the Beast, since the time of the comming in of the Apostacie, when the Churches backslided and became Apostated, from the true Faith.

And these have got the true Prophets words, but are out of the true Prophets life; and these have got CHRISTS words, and the Apostles; and for matter of the outward forme, as Dipping, and breaking of Bread; but are open opposers of the Light and Spirit by which the Apostles were led and guided, and so appeares to the least Child of Light: not to have the Spirit but to be the Naturall men, that discerneth not the things of the Spirit of GOD.
Written and Published to goe abroad in the Army among those that are called Anabaptists:

By one who despiseth no mans Person, but is a witness for God against the deceit of those, which say, they are Saints and are not; but doe lye and are manifest to the least Child of light, to be the Synagogue of Sathan: JONAS DELL.
LONDON, Printed for the Author, and are to be sold at the Bull and Mouth within Aldersgate: And at the Blacks Spread Eagle at the West end of Pauls, 1658.

div.head: A Ʋoyce from the Temple.
div.p: BEhold! and give eare, all you that are called Anabaptists, in the Army, City, and Country: See and consider in what time you are fallen; even in a time of darkness and Apostacie; wherein thick Darkness hath covered you; and a vaile of Ignorance the faces of all Professors, that oppose the light of the world. Oh, how hath darkness, blindness, and ignorance covered you all! even as with a cloake, and a garment. How hath the Eye been blinded? The eare stopped? And the heart hardened? So that the Lord God and his way, his truth, and salvation, hath not been manifestly knowne, heard nor felt, nor witnessed; The words thereof hath been professed, but the power and life thereof hath not been enjoyed; but men have been deceived with a forme of godlinesse, without the power.

And you who are called Anabaptists, aswell as others have been cheated with a likeness of things, without life; and yee have sought the living among the dead; and have worshipped Idols which have been without fence and understanding, and with lying imaginations and feigned likenesses hath the carnall part which ruleth in you above the seed of God bin fed, and with shadowes and outward appearances your Soules have been starved.

Therefore, know the day of your Visitation, and returne to the light of the world; embrace Gods Covenant, that yee may come to feele the life, and so be brought out oft he Apostacie; and out of this night of darkness, wherein you with other Sects have long slept; J say be awakened and consider where you stand, for you are in that Apostacie and night of darkness that CHRIST did say should come, when as no man could worke.

And how it came in the Scriptures doe declare; how the false Prophets, and Antichrists came in, which Christ I say had Prophesied of; and they established the forme of Godlinesse without the Power, and subverted many even whole houses and Countryes, from the Simplicity of Christ Jesus. So that many became insensible and grew past feeling of the Power and operation of GOD, and their minds became blinded, and their eares stopped (at I said before); and God was grieved who had brought up Children and they forgot him, and rebelled against him.

Yea verily the Churches also became corrupted, and lost the life and power of God, and the guift of the Holy Ghost and became Idolaters, and worshippers of Idols, as you may read; Paul prophesied, That many should depart from the Faith, and give heed to seducing Spirits and to the doctrine of Devils. And further saith he, grievous Wolves should enter, not sparing the Flock but seeking to devour it, and would make havock and marchandise of Soules, through Covetousnesse and filthy luore; and saith hee, perilous times would come, wherein there should be a forme of Godlinesse without the power. And in that Generation before, and soone after his decease this came to passe and was fulfilled. As you may read in the Revelation; the Churches grew into Superstitions and Idolatries: The Church of Ephesus had lost her first love, and her Candlestick was to be removed; and so it came to passe. And some in the Church of Smyrna were in the Blasphemy, saying they were Jewes, and were not; but of the Synagogue of Sathan. And the Church of Pergamus, some among them, held the Doctrine of Baalam, and to eat things sacrificed to Idols and to commit Fornication.

And held the Doctrine of the Nicholaitans, which God hated; And the Church of Thyatira suffered that woman Jezabell to teach, and seduced the servants of the Lord, and she and her lovers was to be cast into a bed of torment, and her Children should be killed with Death: and all the Churches should know, that God searched the hearts and tryed the reines. And every one should receive according to their deeds. And the Church of Sardis had onely a name, that they lived, but was
dead, and her workes was not found perfect before God. And upon them would the Lord come, as a Thiefe (so it is written) and they should be in darknesse, and not know what houre hee would come. And the Church of the Laodeceans were luke warme, and neither hot nor cold; and the Lord said, he would spue them out of his mouth; for shee was wretched and miserable, and poore, and blind, and naked, and the shame of her nakedness did appeare, and hee that had an Eare to heare might heare; these things were spoken by him that lives for ever and ever.

div.head: The Amen.
div.p: And so by their back-sliding they became Apostated from the Faith which was before held in a pure Conscience; and the Scripture doth declare, how they became a captivated, and the place where Gods honour had dwelt, came to be poluted, and their Dominions and treasures without, became a Spoyle to the teeth of the devourers. They having lost the Lords treasure, this justly came upon them; and so the holy City which had been full of Glory, was given to the Gentiles to be trodden under foot as the Scripture doth declare: And ever since the Beast and the false Prophet, hath ruled in oppression and the great Whore hath made all Nations drunke with the wine of her Fornication, yea all great Men, and Princes, and Nobles, and all the people upon the earth have bin made drunke by her, and have touched her uncleannesse; and ever since the day of that backsliding and Apostacie, shee hath Sitten upon Nations, and Kindreds, and Tongues, and people; and hath been decked in divers colours, to deceive the hearts of all people; and all Nations have been deceived by her, and when the Apostles were taken off the earth; some by cruell death, and others were banished, then they sprang in more fully, and grew through all Nations, and even to this day hath the Beast with his many heads and hornes ruled in Nations, and hath been worshipped.

And so J say Darkness hath been over all people, and fancies, and likeness without Life, have been bowed under, and the Power being lost, the forme hath been set up one after this sort, and another after that, according to mens vaine conceits and apprehensions upon the Scriptures, and not according to the manifestation
of the Spirit of God, which fulfilleth the Scriptures and brings to live, the life of them; And when the guift of the Ministry through the holy Ghost, which the Ministers of Christ had, was lost and not any more received, then began men to make Ministers by naturall Learning, and Arts, and Languages of humane Policy; and when the guift of Preaching by the eternall Spirit was lost, through the comming in of the Apostacie, then began Man to study from Bookes and writings what to Preach and say, not having the Holy Ghost received in them, which none is a Minister of CHRIST without.
Yea verily, when men had lost through Ignorance the knowledge of God dwelling in them, then began they again to build Temples without, and to set up their false worship in them.

For having lost the true sence of Gods true worship, which the Saints worshipped in the Spirit, and in the truth; then they began to worship in set dayes, and set times, and set places and outward observations; which is not the worship of GOD in Spirit and truth. And all this came in since the dayes of Christ, for hee I say Prophesied, that it should be so as it is come to passe.

They I say having lost the Power, from which the Scriptures was given forth, and not being guided in the Life, which they were in, which spoke them forth, then from the Scriptures in their owne imaginations, without Gods spirit they set up Likenesses, and Images, and Sects, and Formes, and many heads and many hornes grew upon the Beast, which all the world worshipped, and went after; For they had lost Christ the one head wherein Union stood, and so grew into Idolatry under the many heads and hornes which was upon the Beast, which pushed one against another, as it is witnessed unto this day.
The Papists they are a head, and the Protestant they are a head, and they have many Hornes, every head hath severall hornes, yea many hornes.

The Presbyterian so called, they are a head of the Beast, and they have many hornes; and the Independant another head of the Beast, and have many hornes, and every one of these pusheth one against another, and will not bow to each others head, but every one boweth to their owne head.

These all oppose the light of the World, and the birth which is borne from above, and with their Hornes every one of these are pushing at the Manchild, the seed of God, as soone as ever it appeares: its appearance being contrary to that carnall birth which they bring forth.

And this briefly I have declared, that you which are called Anabaptists may come to understand your owne estates; and that you may be made truly sensible that you likewise are one of those many heads, and many hornes of the Beast, and with your severall hornes you push at all these aforesaid.

But you remaine ignorant of the One head and horne of Gods salvation, and this I would have you to know, if you would but turne your minds in ward, to the light of the world; for otherwise you cannot know Christ the one head, as the Saints ever did, and as they doe at this day; Therefore mind all the Saints that are now gathered out of this Apostacie and darke night, unto whom the Light againe is risen; worship Christ the one head, and know him the one horne, which pusheth against the Devils kingdome, which hath been long set up, and ruleth in the Earth among all these aforesaid, who have many heads and hornes.

And you J say who are called Anabaptists, are in this night fallen in the Apostacie and darknesse, which came in as I have said, when the Churches back-slided. Therefore consider your present condition, for under the power of the Beast you are become drunke as well as others, with the wine of her fornication, and the Beast raigneth over you all, with his Dominion and authority; and so with him you are joyned, having the true Prophets words, Christ his words, and the Apostles writings, but from the Light, and out of the Life & power, and the way of God you have not as yet knowne in its purity: but are disputing and jangling about the Letter, what this text meanes and what the other meanes, and a disputing about Election and Reprobation, while in the Reprobate state you remaine: and in which stare you stand, talking of CHRIST and his Kingdome; of which you know nothing, neither have you any share in it, because you belong not to it (as yet) but with the
many heads of the Beast, and in the number of her hornes, you are found opposing the Light of Christ, and denying Christ mafested within to be the true Teacher: So even while you are speaking of Christ, and his Gospell and Kingdome, you are found enemies to it and fighting against it.

But now after a long night of Apostacie and darknesse, which have been upon all the face of the earth, is the Lord appearing and his day dawning, and his Light breaking forth as the glory of the morning, and the kingdome of God is revealed, and his Dominion is setting up after the long raigne of the Beast; and the Lord shall be knowne to be the God of his people; and for this cause hath hee called and chosen faithfull Witnesses, and given his powerfull Ministry by the guift of the Holy Ghost, as it was in the Apostles dayes.

And this I witnesse at this day, that there bee many that are called to declare abroad the things which they have heard and seene and handled, and the Gospell of CHRIST is received by the revelation of Gods eternall Spirit and Son in their hearts. And the power is made manifest, and the forme of Godliness is denyed and judged, and Christ the one head is exalting, and the one horne of Gods Salvation is revealing, which you which are called Anabaptists are opposing, exalting your horne and setting up your formes without Life; denying the Light, and Christ manifested within, in his Saints to be the true Teacher and leader of his People.
Whereby you manifest your selves to be in the Reprobate state, and to be one of those many heads and hornes of the Beast which are to be broken to pieces.

Now consider you that deny the light of Christ which lighteth every man that commeth into the world to be your Teacher, and Christ manifested within to be your guide doe manifest your selves to be Reprobates and children of darknesse, and you and your imaginations are judged and searched by that Spirit of Christ which searcheth all things, yea the deepe things of God, 2 Epist. Corinth. 13. and 5. And if an man have not the Spirit of Christ he is none of is. Rom. 8.9. But hee that hath the Spirit of Christ hath the infallible Spirit. And here
your conditions is judged by the least Child of light, and yee are seene to be reprobates and the naturall men which discerneth not the things of the spirit of God which are above nature. And it is written, That no man can receive the things of the Spirit of God but they who mind somewhat of God in them to receive it withall.

And now take notice, that the least measure of Gods spirit is an infallible guide and without it no man knowes CHRIST, nor can judge of any thing of God or his truth, his Kingdome, or way to it; but lies open to be deceived by the Divell in all things, and to be led by men of corrupt minds, that are from the Light of Christ, which Lighteth every man that commeth into the world. And now here is the ground of all Errours, Sects, and Opinions, Herisies, and Blasphemies that are in the world. It is I say in being led from the guidance of his Spirit, and all live in errour but them that are guided by it, but none ever erred who were guided by it alone. And now you that have not the Spirit that was in the Apostles, you have the Spirit of the world, and that spirit growes not, nor with it you grow not up in grace as the Saints of old did; but now the Scriptures are true, what they speake, but they could never be understood by your fallible Spirit which is contrary to that which gave them forth which is infallible and so to you they are a Parable; who are in that generation that would wrest them to your owne destructions, and to the destruction of others, which were given forth to be fulfilled, and not to be wrested to the understanding of the carnall Spirit.

Now the Scriptures doe declare of the Covenant of Light in which God hath placed all his Promises and power, yea wheie God himselfe dwelleth, even in the light of CHRIST, the true light that lighteth every man that commeth into the world; which was the message that the Ministers of Christ were to declare, which you and other the Ministers of Antichrist doe oppose; therefore take notice that the light of Christ is the onely leader and Guide to all sorts of people, and in all estates of men will be guided thereby, and without believing and following this there is no Salvation; but without it all are in darknesse,
and this I shall make plaine by the Prophets, CHRIST, and his Apostles, and their testimony of it: against whom yee bring your testimony and the rest of the Children of darknesse, even against that Light which is the anointing, which was typified by that pure oyle of the Tabernacle of which the Law and the Prophets prophesiod, even the everlasting Covenant of light, both to Jewes and Gentiles, as saith the Prophet Esay, 24.6. and in the 49. and the 6. GOD cals it a light to the Gentiles, and for Salvation to the ends of the Earth, and in the 10. Chapter and 17. saith he, This light shall burne up as a fire the Bryers and Thornes in his day. Also Esay 60.3.10, and 20. verses, and through his whole Prophesie maketh it the summe of his worke, to fore tell the comming Beauty and power of this Light.

And John Baptist the greatest of all the Prophets, who came to see this Light hee testifieth of him what he is, and what he doth, that through him all might believe, whose whole testimony was of this Light, as is written Iohn the first, saith hee. This is the true Light that lighteth every man that commeth into the world, and cals him the Word that was in the beginning, by whom all things was made; and saith hee, in him was Life, and the life was the light of men, and that this light shined in darknesse, but the darknesse comprehended it not; and this light you that are called Anabaptists doe deny, and so you deny Iohns Ministry, but cannot see your blind Spirit opposing the living Spirit of light and life in all the Saints of God.

But further take notice, that Simeon the Prophet he testifieth to this Light, and saith, hee is prepared before the face of all people a light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of his people Israell, and calls it God's Salvation, Luke 2.30, 31, 32. And saith CHRIST of himselfe, I am the Light of the world, he that followeth me shall not abide in darknesse, but shall have the light of Life, Iohn, 8.12.

But saith the Baptists and others the Ministers and members of Antichrist, this Light is not sufficient of it selfe; and saith Christ, take heed that the light that is in thee be not darknesse,
the light of the body is the Eye; therefore when thine eye is single the whole body is full of light; but when the Eye is evill thy whole body is full of darknesse. Therefore saith hee, take heed that the light which is in thee be not darknesse; and this he spake to the people and the Pharisees Luke 11.

But saith the Baptists and others, it is not to be found in all the Scriptures, that CHRIST nor the Apostles did never counsell Ignorant people to take heed to a light within them; and saith the Priests of this Nation, false and erronious is that Spirit that bids men attend to a light within, and so saith the Baptists. So the Lyer and the Antichrist is now revealing; and there are many Antichrists of you who thus oppose Christ his Light and Doctrine, who have the hornes of blasphemy and dare blaspheame God in his Temple, calling the Spirit of CHRIST false and erronious, and saith, That to suppose that God in men is their Teacher, is an errour not knowing the Scriptures; when as the Scripture saith, Yee shall all bee taught of God, Iohn 6.45. And saith the Apostle, know yee not that yee are the temple of the living God, as God hath said: I will dwell in them, and walke in them, and the temple of God is holy, whose Temple yee are; but say yee Baptists, to suppose God to teach thee is an errour, and so art not afraid (as I said before) to blaspheme God in his temple. And saith the Scripture, all thy Children shall be taught of the Lord Esay 54. and the 13. And they shall teach no more every man his Neighbour, and every man his Brother; Saying know the Lord for they shall all know me from the least of them to the greatest, Ieremiah 31. and 24. Heb. 8. and 11. But saith the Children of darknesse, where the sonne of Perdition fits in the temple of God this is errour, who are strangers to this Covenant of light, and without God in the world; And they are such the Apostle speakes of, Ephes 4. Who because of the blindnesse of their hearts, through the denying the Light within, are alienated from the lights of God and so become past feeling; and so are given up to sinne and plead for it though it be their destruction; For all that deny the Light within are heart blind, and so strangers to the life of God.

And here are all yee Anabaptists so called, enemies to the Light, stumbling at it which is the Corner stone, and so all that oppose and hate the light, loves your evill deeds and so pleads for sinne while you live, and so the words of CHRIST is fulfilled upon you, John 3.19, 20. For every one that doth evill hateth the light, neither commeth to the light lest his deeds be reproved. And further saith Christ, I am the light of the world, that whosoever believeth in me should not abide in darknesse but have the light of Life, and he exhorts the Pharisees and unbelievers, who believed the Scriptures, to believe in the light of the world, which John calleth the true light, which lighteth every man that commeth into the world: And saith Christ, God so loved the world that hee gave his only begotten Son into the world, that whosoever Believed in him should not perish but have Everlasting life; but saith, Hee that believeth not is Condemned already.

And this is the condemnation, That Light is come into the world and men love Darkness rather then Light because their deeds are evill; and this hee spake of them that believed the Letter as yee blind Dippers doe now, but would not believe in the light of the world, as you now who deny Christ to be the Light of the world, and would limit him onely in the Heavens above the skies, and so you manifest your selves to be Reprobates, and enemies to the Light and to the new birth where it is brought forth and witnessed; but say they that Believe, He is a light to lighten the Gentiles, Luke 2. and the 32. and the people that sate in darkness saw a great light, and to them that sate in the region and shadow of Death light is sprung up, Math. 4. and 16. And the Children of light well know that there is no other thing to enlighten them that sit in darknesse whose minds the God of this world hath blinded, but the light of Christ, and till then the Gospell is hid and the vaile is over the heart, and all other meanes till the Eye be opened is unprofitable, and it is his Light alone, which is that Eye, and his Spirit alone, that takes away the vaile, 2 Cor. 3.16, 17. And that it is his Spirit alone that guides into all Truth, Iohn 16. and the 1 • . Even the same Spirit which reproveth the world of Sin, verse the 8. But
saith Antichrist, men are not led into all Truth by a light within, so by that Doctrine, the Spirit of truth must either be within, or else darknesse within; for say you, men are not led into all truth by a light within, but saith the Scripture, Yee have an unction from the Holy one, and yee know all things, and this anointing abideth in you, and yee need not that any man teach you, but as the same anointing teacheth you in all things and is Truth, and is no Lye; and even as it hath taught you yee shall abide in it, and there is no lye of the truth.

And this Spirituall light of Christ, all the holy men of GOD did ever beare witnesse to it, to be that by which they were enlightened, even the Light within which shined out of darkness in their hearts, which gave them the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ, which was their Treasure in the earthen vessels which they Preached, and not themselves, that the praise might be wholly of God who had given them this light in Christ Iesus, whereby to renounce the hidden things of dishonesty; not handling the word of God deceitfully, but by manifestation of his Truth commended themselves to every mans Conscience in the sight of God, and not to the fleshly wisdome, nor brave knowledge, but to the light in every mans Conscience, 2 Cor. 4. And they exhorted them to have no fellowship with the unfruitfull workes of darknesse but to reprove them, and said all things that are reproved are made manifest by the Light, and whatsoever makes manifest is light, and this they Preached for the Light, Ephes. 5.11, 13, 14. And doth also declare, that the want of this Light having their understandings darkened and the blindnesse of their hearts, is the cause why men are past feeling, and so giving themselves over to lasciviousnesse to worke all unrighteousnesse with greedinesse, Ephes 4.18.19. But saith hee, the Saints have not so learned Christ; if they have heard him and been taught by him as the truth is in Jesus, being renued in the Spirit of their minds who sometimes were darknesse but now are light in the Lord, and so walke as Children of the light, bringing forth fruits of the Spirit in all goodnesse, righteousnesse and truth, and this Light was their Message which they declared as the way to the blood of
cleansing: Saith Iohn, this is the Message as wee have heard of him, and declare unto you that God is light and in him is no darknesse at all: and if wee say, we have fellowship with him and walke in darknesse, wee lye and doe not the truth; but if wee walke in the light, as he is in the light we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Iesus Christ his Sonne cleanseth us from all sinne, Iohn first Epist. 1. Chap. 5, 6. and the 7. verses.

And this Light they Preached to keepe out of the occasion of stumbling, and said they that walke in darknesse know not whither they goe, because that darknesse hath blinded their eyes, 1 Iohn 2.10, 11. And this was the end of their Ministry, which was the end of the Covenant and the end of Christs comming even to open the blind eyes, and to bring them that sate in darknesse out of the Prison house, Esay 42. and 7.

And this was the end of the Apostles Ministry, to open their eyes and to turne them from darknesse to light, and from the power of Sathan to God, Acts 26. and the 18. And this Eye was within them that was blind, which they were to open which the God of this world had blinded, which CHRIST calls, the Light of the Body; and therefore hee saith, Take heed the light that is in thee be not darknesse, Luke 11.34. Which Eye the blind guides who love the world and their Sinne have closed, and their Eares they have shut, whose hearts are waxen grosse, so that they cannot neither see, heare nor understand, Math. 13.15. And in this state are you Baptists and all other Teachers, who are from the light blind guides, blind leaders of the blind, who cannot speake according to the Law and Testimony; because you know not the light in you, nor can any but from that light within; And therefore in your blindnesse are opposing the light of the world, which all the Prophets prophesied of. Which had the testimony of JESVS which I witnesse and many thousands at this day to bee the light of the world, who are come to the end of the Law and the Prophets, even to
the new Covenant, where the Law is written in the heart; and to the Spirit of Prophesie which is the testimony of IESVS, which I knew not till that Eye was opened; and therefore went along with you in your blind worship, and selfe taken on performances from the Letter which gave me no Life, which life J now feele and witnesse in the Spirit by Faith in the light of Christ, and his commands in Spirit is life and power; for in obedience to the Faith in the light it is seene and accepted, in which I see you and your labours which are without, not in the light and Spirit, and deny you and your sparkes you are kindling and your literall Teaching and selfe-righteousnesse and all your Brick-making who are in the Egyptian darknesse, enemies to the light of Israell and its seed; and J see you to be enemies to Zions redemption, as you are enemies to the light of the world both in your selves and others.

And this I say further to all your darke generation, that all your boast of Religion and knowledge in the Letter will not bring you, to God without the light of CHRIST, nor can any one, that is in Ignorance come to know the way to Life but by the light of the World; and verily, untill man bee led thereby, hee cannot come out of this darkness even with that Light which reproves the world and manifests your evill deeds, must you bee led; and this all who are enlightened indeed, knowes that hee is the light in the times of darknesse and there is none besides him, and that hee gives Life to all who receive his light and follow it; but those that rebell against the Light, knowes not the wayes thereof nor abides in the pathes thereof, Iohn 34.13. There in that Chapter you may read (Your selves) and your wayes and workes.
And now in-as-much as you doe oppose the Light of the world, you remaine ignorant of the Word and takes the Letter for it, and so did I, till such time that I did adhere to the Light.

And now seeing I have proved you and every man that commeth into the world; to have a measure of light from Christ, which moveth against Sinne, and tels men all things that ever they have done; therefore shew your selves no longer to bee of that man of Sin, that old gaine-sayer, who opposeth your selves against the truth of the Scriptures, and yet would have the Letter thereof to be the Word which you can turne and wrest against the truth, but the Word you know not which cannot be wrested, altered nor changed, nor can you prove the Letter to be it, though many crooked wayes you take to doe it, but it is hard to take the Letter to prove against the Word which doth testifie of the word from whence it came, but seeing you call the Letter the Word, I shall prove that the Letter is not the Word, and the Letter it selfe shall witnesse with me herein.
FIrst, that which one may have, and not have the Word, is not the Word, but one may have the Letter and not have the Word, so the Letter is not it.

That one may have the Letter and not have the Word is plaine, John 5.38, 39. And yee have not his word abiding in you, for whom hee hath sent him you believe not, and further saith Christ, Search the Scriptures for in them you thinke to have Eternall life, and they are they which testifie of me: The Iewes had the Scriptures, and Christ bade them search them, and they thought to have Eternall life in them; but Christ tels them, they had not the Word. So the Letter cannot be the word which one may have, and yet not have the word; for whosoever hath the Word hath Life, but so hath not all who have the Letter, the Word is without beginning or without ending, but so is not the Letter; that which can be changed by men is not the word, but the Letter hath been and is at this day changed by men, 1 Pet. 1.5. and 20. And the word of the Lord came to such as had the Latter, and some of them received it, and some received it not, yet all had the letter and believed it; and all that heare the word it quickens but many heare the letter but are still dead in trespasses and in sins, and such they are who know not how to distinguish betweene the word it selfe
and the letter which is the declaration thereof; which Letter the Divell and wicked men get to plead against the Word and for their sinnes, which is the great use the Letter is wrested to at this day, let any of the servants of God reprove sinne in the word of the Lord, and presently the Serpent gets a Scripture to plead for it, and so to give God the lye, which was the Devils worke before the Letter was, to wit, to oppose the Word in open lying, but now have got the Letter to hide him, and can now come as boldly wich it is written, Luke 4.10. to uphold his sin and imperfection, as ever hee did with his lye to Eve to set up his Kingdome of Sin and imperfection at the first, which then hee got in by subtlety without Scripture, but now by the Letter would maintaine it by force, and if any believe to attaine that estate againe which was lost with blindnesse from the Letter, hee will endeavour to prove him an Heretique and find Scripture to murther him for it also, had hee but power to doe it; And this is the use the Scriptures are of, when such give meanings of them, and preach them whose Eye hee hath blinded and have not the Word in them from which the Scriptures came, and without which none can know them nor understand them; and thus the Jewish Rabbies put Christ to death by the Letter, Iohn 19.7. And so doth hee suffer to this day in whom even hee is, by the worlds Teachers wresting the letter; Therefore saith Peter, such wrest all Scriptures to their owne destruction, 2 Pet. 3.16.

And this is the ground of the Divels enmity against the children of Light at this day; because wee exhort people to the Spirit of Christ and to his Light to enlighten their minds, that so they may not read without understanding, and so wrest the Scriptures to their owne destructions, which things I my selfe did while I was in my fallen wisdome; for while man is in darknesse the best of Gods guifts are perverted to a wrong end, but being enlightened by the Word, the guift is seene and sanctified to its right end, without which it cannot; for God hath placed the blessing and right use of all his mercies in his Sonne who is the Light of the world, the Word by which all things was made and is upholden; Therefore is hee first to be Preached
who is first and last to enlighten people that sit in darknesse, death and delusion, which light being first received, all the guifts of God are yea and Amen therein, to his praise and the Creatures good; for without Faith all is lost, and it is not Faith in the guift that saveth but faith in the giver; for many did believe in the Scripture and thought to have Eternall life therein, but did not believe in the light of the world; and so denied the giver, and the Scripture could not save these, but in there owne thoughts thereof deceived themselves, who had not the Word abiding in them, and so dwell in the Letter but would not come to the light of Life; for it is hee that hath the Sonne that hath life, and not every one that hath the Letter; and such alone have the word of life, which such as stucke in the letter knowes not, nor can heare, John 8.47. Nay, there was many that heard Christ speake, but did not nor could they heare the Word, Iohn 8.43. And this was much more then the Letter; yet such blind and deafe Creatures being blinded by the God of this world, thought to have Eternall life in the Scriptures; but saith Christ, verse 47. Hee that is of God heareth Gods word. Yee therefore heare them not because yee are not of God; yet did Christ speake the words of God, and they did heare him carnally as carnall men doe the letter, and could make him answer to his Speech, but could not heare the words of GOD as Christ plainly said; and here you may all read your blindnesse also, That place Acts 17.11. which you thinke makes so much for you to prove the Letter the Word, it doth but fall on your owne heads, as also other Scriptures doe; For them of Berea was not called more Noble, then they of Thessalonica because they had the Scriptures read, for the Iewes of Thessalonica had the Scripture read every Sabboth day; but this was their Nobility in that they received the Word gladly with all readiness of mind & then searched the Scriptures daily; First they received the Word to enlighten them, and then searched the Scriptures in the light. So this doth plainly prove, that they had not the Word before though they had the Scriptures before: So that here you but prove that the Letter is not the Word, also this place plainly proveth that one may have the
Scripture all their lives and read them in way of Worship constantly; For so did both these sorts of Jewes, and neither knew Word nor Scripture, untill they received the word of Light, but when the Word is received or not received, that makes the difference of Believers and unbelievers, the one ownes, the other envies and persecutes, though both have the Scriptures: This Scripture proves this in the Iewes, and your practice proves the same in you who ate called Anabaptists, who call your selves Christians, but are found by the children of Light to be one of the many Heads and one of the many hornes of the Beast, who are found joyned and joyning with other heads and hornes of the Beast, pushing against the one head and horne of Gods salvation, opposing the light in the Children of light, and yee are found joyning with the lewd People as they did, and stirring up their minds to persecute through your Lies, which otherwise they might be more silent, and so your workes is seene and it makes manifest what word you know: And it makes manifest I say, that ye are one of the many heads and hornes of the Beast pushing at the Truth and at us who beare witness to the Light.

And now further take notice that searching the Scriptures, without the Word first received, yee eannot find the way to Faith as this Scripture doth plainly prove; For till the Eye bee opened with the light of the Word of Life, the Scriptures are a mysterie to the carnall understanding, and all that man can doe with them in that state is to wrest them to his owne destruction, 2 Peter 3.16. And you who are judging of Scriptures, and setting others so to doe without the light of CHRIST, are they who lead the Blind and resist the holy Spirit, as did your Fathers; so doe you resist the Spirit with your imaginations from the Letter.

Therefore bee ashamed of your practice: hath the Spirit given out the Letter to testifie of the light of the World and its sufficiency, and that there is no other way out of the world, but by Christ the Light of the world: and that the Light and the way are one: And doe you pervert this against the Light to prove it not sufficient, hath God given his Word to his seed in every Generation, and hath promised That it shall
not depart out of the mouth of that Seed for ever. Esay 59.21. By which Word the world was made, and all his are to bee guided and Sanctified; and because the Testimony of some few of those who had this Word is in writing, to witnesse that Christ is this word, and that all are to wait for him: And will you take this Letter and pervert it against this Word, to set it in its stead, to keepe People from this word and calling it the Word, which doth but declare of the word.

Now is the deceit of your high notion found out, who have pretended so much Light and Spirit formerly, That now the true light is come and the guift of the Spirit is manifest for every one to profit withall; and you are found the greatest opposers, and have set your selves to make the People evill affected against the Light and Spirits teaching, though no man can say, That Jesus is the Lord but by that Spirit which is given to every one to profit withall, 1 Corinth. 12.7. And so all your Prayers and worships that are out of this Light and before it are blind and abhominable, and all you prove in this your opposing the Light of the world is your selves, Children of darknesse and wholly ignorant of the Spirits teaching and the least Child of light, as J have said before, judges you herein; for the least that ever knew any thing from God, either of Iudgement, Teaching, or Promise, or Power, they know they have it in Spirit, and such know that what the Saints declare of in the Letter which they received of God in Spirit, will not satisfie their longing Soules, unlesse they can have it from God in Spirit also: So that your opposing the spirituall Light and power, doth but give occasion to all that have the least sight of the Spirit, and its teaching to see you heart-blind and so joyning with the God of this world to blind the minds of others also and the least of the Children of light you cannot deceive; With this onely you discover your selves to bee one of those many heads of the Beast exalting your horne, and discovering your Babel, which you have builded without the Light in your imaginations from the Letter, without the light, from whence ariseth and is the ground of all false Worships, Sects and Opinions,
and delusions, the seat of the Hypocrite in which you blesse your selves in darknesse without God in the world, and not to have the Father nor the Son in you, and so are out of the doctrine of Christ, 1 John 9.10.

But where this Light is received and followed, you are therewith seene and discovered, and your worke, and the end of it and in all that you doe, in thus opposing the Light of the world, you are but a breaking your selves against the Cornerstone, like foolish women who are pulling downe your owne house with your own hands: For the more you resist the light the more it shineth, and the more you dispute against the Light and Spirit, the more you are manifest to be out of the doctrine of Christ, who is that light and Spirit: and here you shew your selves (I say) to bee one of the many heads and hornes of the Beast, who thus oppose CHRIST in his Saints; Doth not he say, without me yee can doe nothing, and againe saith he, abide in mee, and I in you, hee that abideth in me and I in him the same bringeth forth much fruit, So shall yee be my Disciples, Iohn 15. and the 4. And doth not Christ say to the Father touching the Saints; I in them and thou in mee, that they may bee made perfect in one, John 17.23. And did not all his Ministers preach the same; did not Paul say, When it pleased the Father to reveale his Son in me, that I might Preach him, Gal. 1.16. And Christ in you the hope of Glory whom we preach, Collos. 1.27. And know yee not that Jesus Christ is in you except yee bee Reprobates, 2 Cor. 13.5. And againe saith Paul, My little Children with whom I travaile in birth againe till Christ be formed in you, Gal 4.19. And hee that hath the Son hath Life Iohn 5.12. And hee that abideth in the doctrine of Christ hath both the Father and the Sonne, and if any com • and bring not this Doctrine, receive him not into your house, neither bid him God speed, 2 Iohn 1.10, 11. Oh how is the hidden things of Esau found out in you! who deny the Light and Christ manifested within to bee your teacher and guide. Are they not blind indeed? Who cannot see Antichrist now revealing, and who they are that deny the Father and the Son, was there ever such a wind Generation? who have denyed the
Light, the Spirit, the Father, and the Son, and now deny the Letter also, that any own should own what is in it declared, further then to talk on. Verily it is time for all that love their own souls, to come out from amongst these blinde Leaders of the blinde, who thus reject and resist the Spirit, and thus blaspheme God in his Temple, 1 Cor. 6.16, 17. Such blind Doctrine, and such blind Discourse, may serve to keep your selves in your imaginations; but among the children of Light it can do no hurt: with the Light are ye comprehended to have formed a Christ in your own imaginations, and your eyes are abroad expecting his coming without you, in observations of persons and forms: lo here, and lo there! and the time and the manner of his reign you are jangling about; and what an One he shall be, and which of you shall be greatest at his coming, and such like conceits without you, hath the enemy up amongst you; till you have wholly lost the favour of Christ within, and can neither know his appearance in your selves, nor believe him in others in whom he is come; nor know what an One he shall be. What a Christ is this, you are looking for? Is he the same that was from the beginning, whose Kingdom is not of this world? And do you look for him after another manner then he hath appeared? Is he not the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever? Hath the enemy of your souls deceived you, and kept you spending hours and days, and moneths, and years talking of him? What he was, and what he will be, at a distance without you; but knows not him what he is. So that when he would appear in you, to lead you out of the world, you know not his voice, nor will you obey him in Spirit, because he is not come in your form, nor teacheth after your will, and in your way. So is he set at naught by you builders, as ever he was; and you cannot receive him in your hearts, neither is there any room for him in the Inne, further then to talk on, which expresses as a covering for your pride and earthly pleasures: Let that of God in your consciences be judge betwixt God and you herein, how you receive the Son of his Love, the Despised One. Search your hearts therewith, and see whether you can receive him who is
set as a sign every where to be spoken against? Will you bear his marks in your bodie? Will you take up his Cross daily, and bear his reproach? Will you own him in whippings, stonings, mockings, and temptations, and to be accounted the filth of the World, and off-scouring of all things for his name sake. Can you be willing to be accounted fools, that his wisdom may be manifest in you? Will you bear his reproach in Stocks, and Prisons, and Dungeons, and to be numbred amongst transgressours? Will you confess him before men, to the loss of your Commissions and Estates? Will you own him in leading you through the loss of all your unjust gain and oppression in your Tradings, or will you follow him to yea and nay, in all your occasions? Shall nothing separate from the love of God, in him who is rejected of all the world.

This is our Christ, and this is his condition in this world, as ever it was; and this is his glory to carry his people through all these things; and above all these in us the eternall Kingdom of the Father, and them present without spot or wrinkle, or any such thing: And this is he whom the world cannot receive, nor all you who are in the worlds pleasures, can see any comeliness in him, nor beauty, whereby you should desire him: for that eye is blind that jangles about him afar off, in the carnall comprehensions and sensual wisdom: It is the eye of Faith that sees him present in the measure, and leads to follow him: And he that believes hath the witness in himself, wherewith his glory is seen in the eternall, the same to all Generations, that will receive him, who is the Light of the world, yet not of this world, nor its glory: from whose root springs Righteousness, Mercy and Judgement, who is meek and lowly; a man of sorrows, and acquainted with grief; who takes no pleasure in unrighteousnesse, nor to set up pride; but shakes his hand at the gain of oppression, and strikes at your life in all unrighteousness.
And that is his witnesse in you, which calls you out of all vaine things, that with his Light hee might bring you out of the world, there to commune with you about your backslidings, and shew you your transgressions, and to let you see the everlasting Covenant of the Fathers love even the Eternall inheritance, which none can come to but they which receive his witnesse in the light, of the which is a crosse to all the worlds sovers and its glory; So if you can receive him you may, if not this J say to you, your expectations will faile, who lookes for his appearance in the worldly Glory or after your imaginations who judge him to bee like your selves, or such a one as you would have him, who have changed your glory for fading things; and so imagine of him also, doe you thinke the Lambe hath changed his glory, because the Beast is got up into his seat; Nay, his glory is the same as it was, though you have changed your God, and have bowed downe your selves to the Prince of the world and his glory, and have committed adultery therewith, yet God is the same, and changes not.

Therefore come downe you painted Harlots, you Adulterers and Adulteresses, whose minds would uphold carnall things and carnall delights, and live in foolish mirth which is madnesse and folly, and bring Scripture to plead for it, and yet professe the name of the Lord JESVS; Verily this is the word of the Lord to you all, you are an ill savour to the people of God, and to the Narions whom the Lord is about to gather, who say you are the people of God but live as bad or worse then the Heathens, you are the enemies of God, yea verily and your profession stinkes in his nostrils: Alas doe you thinke! hee will accept your words, while your Lives preach rebellion openly, and have begot a faith in one another to believe that God will accept you herein, I mind chiefly you who are in the Army, when as a CHRIST you looke for conformable to your Kingdome of pride and worldly glory, selfe-worship, and respect of persons; where you have followed the Heathen into that Principle, where man erres thither are you gone out of the Faith of Christ which stands not in respect of persons, neither can you believe, who receive honour one of
another, so your hope shall perish, and your sorrow shall come upon you in one day, except you repent and return; though now you put it afar off, yet shall you one day see, that vain words shall not serve, nor save, where Light and Life is denyed. Consider that place of Scripture, Luke 13.24, 25, 26, 27, 28, & 29. verses: Strive to enter in at the strait gate, for many, I say unto you (saith Christ, the Light of the world) will seek to enter in, and shall not be able; therefore consider the day of your visitation: You are in the Letter, but out of the Life; for when once the Master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without and knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord open unto us: and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence you are: then ye shall begin to say, We have eaten and drunk in thy presence, and thou hast taught in our streets: but he shall say, I tell you I know you not whence you are, Depart from me all ye workers of iniquity: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and all the Prophets in the Kingdom of God, and you your selves thrust out. And they shall come from the East, West, North and South, and shall sit down in the Kingdom of God, and behold, there are last, which shall be first, and there are first which shall be last: He that hath an ear to hear let him hear.

And now consider all you whose unity stands in the visibles, and by them are gathered together, and there you receive and know one another, and that you make the door to receive into your Churches, as without it no communion, whose knowledge is outward, and your worship outward, as in Words or Water, Bread, and Wine, which are carnal perishing things, though good in their time and place, to them who in their place could use them: yet were they not given as the substance but as the shadow: not in the place of God, but in way of obedience to God, as many other carnal things which in their place was not to be omitted, as Temple, Circumcision, Sacrifices, Brazen-Serpent, which were good, till set in the place of God; and till they who had them, set them up against
truth and righteousness, and became as bad, if not worse, then they that had them not; yet blessed themselves in their evil ways because of them, and excluded all else: Then the Lord departed out of them, and left them empty and desolate, and his appearance cryed them down, as things without life, and set up the substance of them within: So that God hath been forced all along to pull down, what he himself did set up, though never so good, yet if carnal, the carnal minde would get into them, and adulterate from the Maker, as you may read in the Scriptures, how many things God hath laid waste upon that account, even at his appearance in some of his sons and daughters; even such things, as he had said should be signs for ever, yet their abuse caused the Servants of God, to cry them down: So your carnal things wherein God and his power, and righteousness is not, your setting them up instead of Christ makes them odious to all, that knows Christ, and they cannot endure, to see that which belongs to God given to any creature and be silent.

Well! but you will say, that they be commands of God, and there is no Scripture for taking them away. To which I answer; That those carnal things are but commands, as Circumcision and the Passeover were, and many other such like: yet were they taken away without Letter, by that Spirit that gave them, when they were abused. What Letter had Hezekiah to take away the Brazen-Serpent, and break it in pieces? What Scripture had Paul to cry down Circumcision? or what Scripture bad he to deny that he was sent to Baptize, when he saw them abuse it, and setting it up above Christ; and many other things which the Spirit of God, when Idolized, for which the literal Observers, who denyed the Spirits teaching, counted them blasphemers, as you Baptists and other Professors do now: and so by such they suffered for holding out the substance, and denying the shadows to such as Idolized them: Though otherwise the shadows had been lawfull: Neither do I judge any that do it in obedience, and so come up above it. But all you that stick in these outward things, contending about Dipping, and Sprinkling, and breaking of Bread, but neglect
the power and life: You are the Jews of these days, who strive about outward washings, some for young and some for old, but in the mean time all our of the power, and in the world, in your own wills, and worldly pleasures, and profits, pride, and covetousness, some for Free will, others not, but all in your own wills; and thus while you are about these things received by Tradition, the Law of God, written in your hearts is made of none effect. Nay you cannot own it, that there is any thing there, to guide or give the knowledge of God. So you have a form of godliness, but the world hath power over you and in you; and so are become a reproach to Religion.

Therefore come out of the world, and the power of darkness, and come to the guide of the Spirit of truth, that you may be set free, to the Lord, and from the rudintents which God is departed out of, and follow ye the Lamb whithersoever he goeth: And then shall ye see him separating you from the world into the substance of truth, in Mercy, and righteousness before you be hardened in your wickedness, and before your form, be left to you desolate, and a strange thing come upon you, which is already seen concerning some of you, who will not now own his appearance who before all forms was, and is. And now consider, you that are not yet entred into persecution, though opposing: Is it not a sad thing, to see how some, who above all did cry out for Liberty of Conscience, and against persecution, who have been persecuted for Conscience sake, that are now become the most subtle persecutors, that ever were in this world, you in this Generation be not grieved to hear of these things; for God is bringing strange things to pass, which you will not believe as yet, though it be told you. But when it is come upon you, remember you have been told; for the Lord is gathering his seed out from the Heathen, where it hath been scattered, and they that will not be gathered shall be scattered; and they that will not come into the Kingdom of the Lamb shall be left among beasts, and all you that denies the Spirit of God to lead you, are no better, and that eye is blinded that foresees not the evil; therefore take heed you fall not into mischief ere you be aware.

dateline.date: The sixth of the ninth moneth 1657.

div.head: It is written, What things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ, saith Paul to the Philippians; yea doubtless and I count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord; for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but dung, that I I may win Christ, and be found in him, not having mine own righteousness which is of the Law, but that which is through the Faith of Christ, the righteousness, which is of God by Faith, Phil. 3.7, 8, 9.
div.p:
NOw the end of this my declaring is, that you might no longer kick against the pricks, by opposing the light of the world, and that you might no longer jangle against Gods Covenant of Love, which lets you see your sins, and reproves you in secret for all that you have ever done: Is not this the light of the world, is not this Gods Covenant, wherein consists eternal life? yes verily? Therefore I say contend no longer for those things which God is departed out of, which are become the seat of the hypocrite, in which for a long time, and yet at this very day the hypocrite dwells, as in Water-Baptism, Bread and Wine, and such like, in which the Saints never witnessed life, but could and did use them, till they were abused, and became the seat of the Hypocrite, and likenesses without life, a form without power: Therefore profess no more then you possess; for (I say) to walk in, and to practise these outward things, and not to feel the power, and witnesse it, you do but deceive your own souls; for the outward Tradition and Ceremony of the Church of Christ, is nothing without the power of Christ in you, which changes the heart, and brings to live the life of godliness; for now all the world almost are become Professors of the outward Letter, and are Professors of it; but of the mysterie of Godliness remain ignorant, and feel not the power thereof, and so wrest the Scriptures to their own destruction, as I have said. Alas! How are the Scriptures abused, and wrested at this day, by all sorts of Professors,
who erre from the light of Christ, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.

Therefore this is the word of the Lord God of Life, and Power, and Righteousness to you all, be silent and wait in the light, that you may come to feel the life; for more precious is the power then the Letter, where it is felt and witnessed; for the Scriptures (of truth) are not to be compared with the power which gave them forth, though I confess the Scriptures are a true declaration of glad tidings, and are precious to those, and to all that can witnesse them fulfilled, who feel a measure of that Spirit and Power from whence they were given forth: But where the power is not felt and witnessed, there the Scriptures serve for nothing but to talk on, as I have said, and men keep themselves in action, but to no profit, being from that Light which would let them see; and being from that Spirit, and out of that power which gave them forth, they remain ignorant of the Spirit of Prophesie; for Prophesie came not of old time by the will of man: But holy men of God spake as they were moved by the Holy Ghost, 2 Pet. 1.21. Yea, and saith Peter, We have a more sure word of prophesie, whereunto you do well to take heed, as unto a light which shines in a dark place, till the day dawn, and the day Star arise in your heart. Now by taking heed to the Light of Christ, which every one is lighted with which cometh into the world, and hath a measure of, bringeth to the dawning of the perfect day, and into a perfect state in Christ, which never any came to, nor never shall come to, but by waiting for, and walking in the motions and movings of it: yea, so it is written, If we walk in the light as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin, and there is no occasion of stumbling in him, 1 John 1.7. 1 John 2.8. & 10. verses. So that J say, the very first step to the dawning of a perfect day, and to a perfect state in Christ is by a solemn waiting upon God in the light of the world; which God hath set for a Covenant, a light to lighten the Gentiles, and the glory of his people Israel, Luke 2.32. And verily, this I can witnesse was my great mistake for many
yeares together, and the maine reason why I erred and run out to this man and the other man, and out of one forme into another, and was unstedfast and unsetled, talking of the truth, but out of it, I say because I tooke not heed to the light which I was lighted withall which moved in me against sin, and here have all erred that are at this day out of the power and life of truth, crying loe here and loe there, and yet out of the power and from the life of the Prophets and holy men of God, it is their being from that of God in them, it is in being from the Light, from the anointing, which is the true Teacher in every one, in the male and female. Men running out in the Letter in their owne wils, not minding the light which otherwise would bring to a perfect day, & a perfect state in Christ even to be borne of a perfect birth from above, brought forth in the true Faith, which the gates of Hell shall not prevaile against; but not abiding in the Light which manifests sinne and would subdue the Lusts and slay the enmity, and wholly destroy the workes of the devil if mendid abide in it; This was the great defect of the Anabaptists so called, in not rightly observing and not truly understanding, what the Letter directed too, when it saith, Repent and be Baptised and yee shall receive the guift of the Holy Ghost; But here I say, not minding what the Letter directed to, runne out from the light in their own wills to Preach and Dip, and to give interpretations of the Scriptures in their falne wisdome and so run from the guift of the Holy Ghost, for that was never attained to, but where it was waited for: yea the Apostles themselves was to wait for it, and did wait for it before it fell upon them, and saith Christ, Tarrie at Ierusalem till you are indued with the Power from on high. Luke 24.49. And Christ after his Resurrection being assembled with his Disciples, commanded them that they should not depart from Ierusalem but wait for the Promise of the Father (which saith hee yee have heard of me) for Iohn truly Baptized with water, but yee shall be baptized with the Holy Ghost not many dayes hence, and yee shall receive Power after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you and yee shall be witnesses unto me, both in Ierusalem and in all Indea, and in Samaria, and unto the uttermost parts of the earth, Act. 1.4, 5 & 8. verse. Act. 11.15, 16.

But you who are the professed Ministers called Anabaptists, you made too much hast, and ran out in your own wils in your sensuall wisdome, in which you yet stand in the enmity against God, taking the Letter to oppose the Spirit, so you not waiting in the light to receive the guift of the Holy Ghost in the power of your own wils you stand, and in your own wils you Preach and Dip, and breake Bread, and not in the power of God, which is the true call of a Minister of Christ; without which your Ministry is imperfect, and also your Church, but had you waited till you had received power from God, he would have sent you to preach in his Name, and power, and to have let Dipping alone, which hee was departed out of, before the decease of the Apostles or soone after; and it was become a thing of no repute, being become the Hypocrites Idols, as indeed it is at this day; for verily no better are any of you who live in the practice of it, and are out of the power of God opposing that Spirit in others, which would let you see to goe right on your way, and verily that place in Mathew 28. makes nothing to prove the universality of Dipping; Where it saith. Goe teach all Nations Baptising or Dipping them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Ghost: And lo J am with you always even to the end of the world; for that world was at an end, & there was an end of that when the power the gift of the Holy Ghost was lost; as the power was lost when the Apostacie came in, which Power, the gift of the Holy Ghost you have not again regained, nor received who deny the Light of the world, & Christ manifested within to be your Teacher and guide; and though Christ did say, Loe I am with you alwaies to the end of the world; it is to bee understood no further nor no longer time, then the end of that dispensation; as in other cases where God said, This shall be a Covenant for ever, when as it teached but to the end of that generation, as you may read in the 17. Genes. 13. Where God saith to Abraham, I will make with thee an everlasting Covenant, and saith he, this is the Covenant I will make with thee, Every male shall be Circumcised, and this Covenant upon these conditions did last but for a time; for we read that God did afterwards make a new Covenant with his
people that should never be ended; So in like manner the Priesthood of Aaron and his Sonnes was called an everlasting Priesthood, and yet that had an end and was changed into the Priesthood of CHRIST that abideth for ever and ever, and we are said to be changed, from one Everlasting to another everlasting, which shewes there are more everlastings then one; So that one Everlasting is but the time during of the same dispensation under which wee are for a time untill our change comes.

Therefore let all flesh be silent before God and in the Light wait, to receive power from God and give over your Imagemaking, for you and your Images, your likenesses and formes without life will the Lord leave desolate and you perish in darkness; wherefore arise ye and depart for this is not your rest, because it is polluted it shall destroy you with a fore destruction, Micha, 2.10. You that have taken up your rest and dwell in the imitations of others, in the shadowes and in the outward forme out of the life of God, and are from the Spirit, yee abide in death, and are in the way to destruction, and you remaine ignorant of the true worship of God, you be so farre from being of the true Church of God, which is in God that you know it not, but with the Hypocrites yee worship without the gate in the Court, without the Temple which is no more to be measured but is for the Wine-presse of the wrath of God there to be trodden under foot, Revel. 11.1, 2. Revel. 14.19, 20. Nay verily the worship of God which is pure you know not, there the Hypocrite comes not, they that are from the pure Light are out of the pure Worship which is in Spirit and in truth.

Therefore consider where you stand all of you which oppose the Light of the world, you have slaine Gods witness in you and to every good worke you are Reprobates, and here you come under the notion of Blaspheamers who say you are the Church, and the Saints of God and are not; Yea saith the Spirit to the Church in Smirna, J know the blasphemy of them, which say they are Iewes and are not, but are the Synagogue of Sathan, Revel. 2. and 9.

Therefore read your owne Conditions you Anabaptists in the Army who thus oppose the Light, and bring Scripture to plead for Sin, who are not come to Yea and Nay, nor to witness a bridle to your Tongues, but are found in the Idle frothy discourse of the Common sort of the world, which never made any profession of Religion: and when as I told some of you, that as a Witness of God I stood against that folly and madness committed by the Souldiery upon the Guard, which you were accessary to, and thou Robert Hazleow didst bring Scripture to prove the lawfulness of sin; and now that thou maist repent of this thy wickedness, and bewail thy hypocrisie, I shall in the fear and dread of the righteous God of life and power, from whose presence the wicked shall not escape: shew thee thy great mistake in that place of Scripture, which thou didst bring to maintain madness and folly, which is in Eaclesiastes 3.1. Where Solomon saith, To every thing there is a season, and to every purpose under the heaven. But be thou advised in the fear of the Lord; for to commit sin was never Gods purpose. But saith God, Lo, I have made man upright! but he hath sought out many inventions: But thou declarest thus to plead for sin.

Sayest thou Solomon saith, that there is a time for all things; and therefore thou dost conclude that there is a time for laughter, madness, and folly, which in the fear of God I deny: though there be time that men do take to commit sin, that time is abused and mispent, that is not improved to Gods glory, and though thou wouldst make the Scripture a cloak to cover thy wickedness, and the wickedness of others; yet know that they were never given forth for that end, but that men should fear before him, who is able to take you a way in the act of sin, verse 14. and in ver. 16. saith he; Moreover, I saw under the Sun, the place of Judgement, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness that iniquity was there. And now compare the first verse with the 17. and see how much it makes for thy purpose to bear thee out in madness and folly: J said in my heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked; for there is a time there for every purpose, and for every work. And in another place, saith he, Young man take thy pleasure in thy youth, and let thy heart chear thee in thy young days, and fellow the lusts of thine eyes; but remember that
for all these things God will bring thee to judgement: And further, saith he, touching himself, I will prove thee with mirth; yea he set his heart to take delight in all things under the Sun, as in Gardens and Orchards, in Men-singers and Women-singers, and all sorts of Musick: but when he had taken his full swinge, and had what might be had in the whole Creation, he cryes out, All is vanity and vexation of Spirit: and saith he, let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter; Fear God, and keep his Commandments, for this is the whole duty of man: for saith he, God shall bring every work into judgement, with every secret thing, whether it be good or evil.

Therefore in the fear of the Lord God of life, and power from whose presence, I say, the wicked shall not escape unpunished: Bring not the Scriptures to plead for sin, nor to maintain your wicked practises; for this is a horrible filthy thing in the sight of God, and it shall lie heavy upon you one day, when the secrets of all hearts shall be laid open; then the Light of Christ, which is Gods witness, which you have slain and murthered, which you will not now own, shall then rise up in you and condemn you: Therefore I say be not so wicked as to bring Scripture to plead for sin nor make no provision for the flesh, to fulfill the lusts thereof; for, for every idle word that man shall speak, and for every vain and idle thought shall be brought to light. Therefore saith the Apostle. Be ye followers of God, as dear children, for filthiness, and foolish talking, and jesting, and such like things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience; be ye not therefore partakers with them; for ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord, walk as children of the light: As much as to say, bring forth nothing that is evil, but bring forth the fruits of the Spirit, which is in all Godliness and Righteousness, and Truth, proving what is acceptable unto the Lord, and have no Fellowship with the unfruitfull works of darkness, but rather reprove them, for it is a shame to speak of those things which are done of them in secret. And in the fear of the Lord be ye ashamed, who bring Scripture to plead for Sin, Madness and Folly. Read the fift of the Ephesians, where you may see that all things that are reproved are made manifest by the Light; for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.
therefore, I say to you all, who oppose the Light, and plead for sin, and are asleep, and blinde, and dead, as to the things of God, I say, awake ye, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give you light: nay, verily Christ hath given you light, for he lighteth every man that cometh into the world, as I have said, and proved by the Scriptures of Truth; but you with the man of the world are disobedient to it, and will not believe in it, but are gone out from it, and so are jangling one with another about the Scriptures, but do not understand them, because you are from the light, which is the talent which God hath given to every one to profit withal; which if you did turn your minds inward to, you might have all things opened in you which is meet and necessary for you to know: yea, saith the Apostle to the Romans, Rom. 1.28. and 19. verses, That which may be known of God is manifested in them; for God hath shewed it unto them, but as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge, God gave them over to a reprobate minde: And verily this is your condition, or the condition of many of you in the Army, who are called Anabaptists, you do not like to retain God in your knowledge, but are gone out from your measures, from that of God in you, which is pure, and are gone out from the light, and so you are unprofitable servants, who have hid your talent in the earth, and so remain ignorant of the Kingdom of heaven, though great talkers of it without you; but verily, you must come to know it within you, or else remain still ignorant, for without you, you cannot know it.

Therefore turn your minds inward, to know the kingdom of heaven which Christ likens to a grain of Mustard seed, which is the least of all seeds in you; but this is a mysterie to you that be from the light gone out in your faln wisdom, talking of the kingdom of heaven, and the Prophets words, Christs words, and the Apostles; but are, I say, from that of God in you which is pure and perfect, which you have not as yet felt, nor tasted, because in it you have not believed, and so are from that which the Prophets and Holy men of God were in; and from that which was from the beginning by which the world was made: And so I say you are disputing, and jangling one with another about that which you call Religion, but are from the Light, and out of the Life, alwayes learning, but never able to come to the knowledge of the Truth.

It is not long, since I heard you disputing one with another about the Image of God, in which man was made, and as far as I could gather from you all, you did conclude, that the Image of God, was that understanding which Man had given him, above all other Creatures.

To which I answer, and would haue you to take notice is this, that in the Fall, man wholly lost the Image of God, and as he stands in that state, he is altogether ignorant of the Image of God, neither can you, nor any other Professors, as you stand in the Fall: in your faln wisdom enemies to, and opposers of the Covenant of Light, know the Image of God; for Christ the eternal Son of God, is the Image of God, and in and by him was all things made, and without him was not any thing made, that was made.

And this is the word of the Lord to you, and to all the Professors in the World, that Christ Jesus, the eternal Spirit of the Father, is the Image of God, which we read of in the Letter. And you that are called Anabaptists, and all other Professors who are alienated from the Life of God, and opposing the Light of Christ, cannot know the Image of God, which is Christ, Spiritually considered; but as every one doth adhere to the Light, which God hath given for a Light to lighten the Gentiles, and to be the glory of his people Israel: And now as every one doth believe in the light which comes from Christ, who is a quickening Spirit, and as every one yields obedience to it, they shall be brought to the dawning of a perfect day, and to see the Image of God, and to have the Image of God again restored, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory: So in few words, he that hath the Son hath life, and he that can witness the life of Christ in him, and is raised from a death in sin to a life of Grace, he can witness the Image of God again restored; for the Image of God was wholly lost as to man! (for the present) but not decayed, as J have sometimes heard the Priest of the world, pray to God to restore his decayed Image again to man; nay, though the Image of God was wholely lost (as to man) yet it was not decayed: but firm in God, though wholly lost as to man, as he stands in the alienated estate, a stranger to the Covenant of Light & so without God in the world.

And this is your condition who are called Anabaptists, who
do not believe in the Light, but are opposers of it; yea in this state do you stand, who bring Scripture to plead for sin: yea J say in the alienation do you stand Strangers to the life of Christ, who are not come to yea and nay, nor to witness a bridle to your tongues; but are found in the carnal Discourse of the world; and in the many fashions thereof: and cannot bear the true language of the Scriptures, as Thee and Thou to a single person, which was always the Language that was used by Christ, and his Disciples, and by Believers one to another, as thus saith Christ to Nicodemus, art (Thou) a Master in Israel, and knowest not these things: Minde, Art (Thou) a Master? And saith Peter to Christ, Though all men should deny (Thee) yet saith he, to Christ, to his Master, I will not deny thee. And now but minde, Christ doth not say, that he was a saucy Fellow because he did not put off his hat, and say, Sir, I will not deny you. But you that are called Anabaptists, if any man is but a little below your degree or estate, though a brother in Fellowship with you, as you call it, yet J say, if thou art a Commission Officer, one below thee, as Sergeant, or Corporal, or a Private Souldier, if he say thee, or thou to thee, he is counted by thee to be a saucy Fellow: and in the transgression, if he put not off his Hat, and say, you Sir: Oh horrible prodigality!

Now consider, thou art not only out of the Life of the Scriptures, but art from the Letter also. And Christ said to Peter, Before the Cock crow twice (thou) shalt deny me thrice: And saith the Damsell to Peter. (Thy) speech bewrayeth (thee:) She did not say, (your) speech Sir, bewrayeth (you) and saith the woman of Samarta to CHRIST, How is it (thou) being a Jew, askest drink of me, John 4.9. and in verse 10. saith Christ to the woman of Samaria; If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to (thee) give me to drink (thou) wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given (thee) living water: And ver. 11. saith she to Christ, (Thou) hast nothing to draw with, and the Well is deep & from whence then hast (thou) this living water: And v. 12. saith she, Art thou greater then our father Iacob, &c. And in ver. 17. saith Christ to the woman. (Thou) hast well said five husbands, and he whom (thou) now hast, is not thy husband, ver. 18. And in ver. 19. saith she, I perceive, that (thou) art a
Prophet. And in the 26. verse, Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto (thee) am he: And in John 9.17. What saiest (thou) of him: and ver. 18. Thou art his disciple; and in ver. 34. (thou) wast altogether born in sin: and ver. 35. Jesus said, Dost (thou) believe on the Son of God: and in ver. 37. Jesus said unto him, (Thou) hast both seen him, and he it is that talketh with (thee.) And Mary and Martha in their message to Christ, concerning Lazarus his sickness, sent unto him, saying, He whom (thou) lovest is sick, Joh. 11.3. And ver. 8. The Jews of late sought to stone (thee,) and goest thou thither again: and v. 21. Martha said unto Iesus, Lord if (thou) hadst been here my brother had not died: & v. 22. Martha said unto Iesus, I know that even whatsoever (thou) wilt ask of God, God will give it (thee:) and v. 26. Iesus saith to her, Whosoever liveth & believeth in me shall never die believest (thou) this: and v. 27. saith she unto him. Yea Lord, I believe that (thou) art the Christ, the Son of the living God: and v. 32. Mary, said unto Christ, Lord if (thou) hadst been here my brother had not died: and v. 40. Iesus saith unto her. Said I not unto (thee) that if thou wouldst believe? (thou) shouldst see the glory of God.

And Iesus said unto his mother, Woman what have I do to with thee, my hour is not yet come, Joh. 2.4. And v. 10. (Thou) hast kept the good wine until now. When she was weeping at the Sepulcher, they said unto her, Woman why weepest (thou?) Ioh. 20.13. and this was the Language that Believers used one to another. Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing; they say unto him, We also go with (thee) Ioh. 21.3.
