And after that Christ was risen from the dead, he saith to Simon Peter, Simon Son of Ionas, lovest (thou) me; he saith unto him, Yea Lord (thou) knowest that I love thee. And ver. 13. Iesus said, Verily, verily, I say unto (thee) when (thou) wast young (thou) girdest thy self, and walkest whether (thou) wouldst; but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry (thee) whither thou wouldst not. And Iesus saith unto him, What if I will that he tarry till I came? What is that to (thee?) follow (thou) me.

And this was the manner of Christs speaking to Believers, and thus did believers speak to Christ; he said, thee and thou to them, and they said Thee and Thou to him: and the Disciples said Thee and Thou one to another; and thus did both Believers and unbelievers:
And saith Peter to Ananias, Why hast (thou) conceived this thing in thy heart (thou) hast not lyed unto men, but unto God, Acts 5.4. Likewise said he to Simon, (Thou) hast neither part nor lot in this matter, Acts 8.21. For I perceive that (thou) art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity, vers. 23. And this was the true language, from the beginning of the Prophets to the decease of the Apostles, as you may read in the Old Testament, that even children did (thee) and (thou) their Parents; and servants did (thee) and (thou) their Masters; yea the inferiors did (thee) and (thou) their Superiors, which would be frivilous for me to mention in this Treatise. But briefly to conclude, saith Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, Be it known unto (thee) O King, we will not bow down, nor worship the golden. Image which (thou) hast set up, &c. And Philip did (thou) the Eunuch a man of great authority, as you may read Acts 8.27. And ver. 30. saith he, Vnderstandest (thou) what (thou) readest: and ver. 37. saith he, If thou believest with all thy heart, (thou) mayest &c.

Therefore consider, all you that are called Anabaptists in the Army, City, and Country, how you are gone out from that of God in you, which is pure, and how ye do erre from the Letter of the Scriptures, who cannot bear the true Language of the Prophets, Christ, and his Apostles: Therefore, I say, be ashamed of your ignorance and hypocrisie, who say you are Christians, and do call your selves the Church of Christ, but do lye, who say you are Saints, and are not but are of the Synagogue of Satan, and of the concision, who do not worship God in the Spirit, nor rejoyce in Christ Jesus, but have confidence in the flesh, Phil. 3.2. Therefore I say, consider how far ye are gone out from the Saints rule, & how far ye are out of the Saints life; when one that is a believer in Christ saith Thee or Thou to any single person of you who have a Commission, though in the lowest; nay a Sergeant or a Corporal, yea even those of you in the lowest degree, cannot bear Thee nor Thou from a believer in Iesus, who is come out of the worlds fashions & vain customs, & now you being from the light, & out of the life of Christ, you are one with the world, & seek honor one of another, & give that to one another, which belongs to God, & so being gone out into the world from the light, from Gods witness, you are blind and understand not Gods way, nor know not his worship wch is in spirit
and in truth, nor do you know his Servant, who so worship him, who cannot bow to you, but refuse it; for which you swell and look big upon them; because they cannot give that to you which you look for: And verily know this, that I am come out of your ground, and I cannot observe your fashions, nor bow down to your Images, nor worship your Persons, to me it is an horrible filthy thing, and I know it is odious in the sight of God: Therefore, I say, in the fear of the Lord, consider where you stand, for you are degenerated, from what you were, and become many degrees worse, then you were eight or nine years ago: you had then something in you, which brought you out from the Steeple-house worship, had you abode in it; which let you see that their worship was not right: which was the light of Christ, which you now deny and dis-own, which is the Light in which all men should walk; for he is the light of men, and the life of men, and so a rule of life unto men, from which you are degenerated, and become like the barren ground, and like the parched heath, and like unto dry trees, twice dead, plucked up by the roots, and valew a Commission, and a little Honour, more then the true Worship of God; for you are become Steeplehouse hearers again, to hear those Diviners again, who divine for money, and teach for filthy lucre, which the Lords Prophets cryed out against; which Jeremiah said was a horrible filthy thing; and that which have brought you to it, is that which the Prieststeach for, even for the love of money, and for the love of honour: thus have you forsaken the right Way, even CHRIST and his Light, and are gone astray from him, and his Light, which should let you see, to go right on your way: But you are following the way of Balaam who loved the wages of unrighteousness, as Jude hath said in his Epist. 2. You have gone in the way of Cain, and run greedily after the errour of Balaam, for reward, acceptations and greatness, which is unrighteousness.

Therefore consider what will be your reward, you have gone in the way of Cain, as for looking for honour, acceptation and respect for your own Works, Religion, Holy Duties, and so forth, as performed by you, which at best is but as the fruit of the ground or an earthly Offering, or as Calves of a year old, which God
hath no respect unto: therefore no reward will be given you, but what is according to your offering, but you have run greedily after the errour of Balaam, which is much like this of Cain, willing to be promoted in the world as to honour and greatness, or accounted Religious, though it be in the way of unrighteousness, with zeal of Religion, walking in the outward Form, but out of the life, and not able to bear the true language of the Scripture. Therefore consider where you stand, for you are out from that of God, in you as I have said, which is pure, yea out from the light, which manifests sin, and would bring you out of the ways of the world, and out of the Kingdom of it, into the Kingdom of Christ, and into the City of the living God, into the Fathers house were you obedient to it; but being, I say, from that of God in you, from the light, and in the shadow, in the outward Form, without Life: so you are but in the outward Court, or Carnal State, worshipping in the flesh without the Spirit; and so the best of your Religion, zeal, and holiness in the flesh, and in your own wills, is I say, but in the outward Court, or without the gate in the flesh, where our Lord was erucified: so being from the Light, and out of the Life, and power, you are but as wells without water, and as clouds without rain, and as trees without fruit; which for cumbring the ground are accursed: and the Voice from the Temple makes you manifest to be of the Serpents seed, which lyeth under his vail in flesh, Rev. 2.13.

It is written, Rejoyce thou barren that bearest not, break forth and cry thou that travellest not; for the desolate hath many moe children then she that hath a husband. Now we brethren, as Isaac was, are the children of promise: but as then, he that was born after the flesh persecuted him that was born after the Spirit, even so it is now. Nevertheless what saith the Scripture. Cast out the bondwoman and her son; for the son of the bond-woman, shall not be heir with the Son of the free-woman. So then brethren, we are not children of the bond-woman, but of the free, Gal. 4.27, 28, 29, 30, & 31. verses.

Also it is written, That they are not all Israel which are of Israel, neither because they are the seed of Abraham, are they all children; But in Isaac shall thy seed be called. That is, they
which are the children of the flesh, these are not the children of God; but the children of the promise are counted for the seed, Rom. 9.6, 7, 8. As it is written, If ye be Christs, then are ye Abrahams seed, and heirs according to the promise, Gal. 3.29. Now to Abraham and his seed were the Promise made, he saith not, and to seeds, as of many, but as of one; and to thy seed which is Christ, Gal. 3.16.

Therefore turn your minds inward, there to learn to know the seed of God in thee to bear rule; for there is a birth, and there is a seed which God doth disown, which hath no right to Gods inheritance: The Son of the Bond-woman, as saith the Scripture, must not be heir with the Son of the Free-woman: therefore it saith, Cast out the Bond-woman and her Son, for she must not be heir with the Son of the Free-woman. Now the seed of the Free-woman where it is brought forth, manifested, and witnessed within; it • lays the enmity, and breaks the Serpents head; and dasheth the heads of all the Babylonish Children, which are after the flesh, against the stones.

Now the end of my declaring is, that you may examine your selves, and know which seed you are of, or in, or which seed is in you, bearing rule, and that you may know, I say, which seed rules in you; for his servants you are to whom ye obey, and the way to know this, is to turn to the light, and the Light will make manifest, for in the light is the Serpent, the enemy of your souls, discovered; and in the Light is the other Seed begotten and brought forth, which doth cast out the Serpents seed. So it is written, The Seed of the woman shall break the Serpents head: yea, as you yield obedience to the Light, you shall come to witness the new birth, and the man childe born in you; and you shall feele his power, who binds the Strong man Armed and casts him out. But you that are called Anabaptists, and all other Professours, who are in your first nature and faln wisdom, remain ignorant of the Seed Christ Jesus, which is GODS Covenant felt and witnessed in his Saints, in which and by which we are led, and by which the enmity is slain in us, and all the works
of the Devil destroyed, and a destroying, whereas you Baptists do manifest your selves not to be of this seed, who are yet in the enmity, opposing the Light, and denying this Seed, and acting in, and yeelding obedience to the other Seed, and so are worshipping GOD in your own imaginations, and earthly, aiery mindes, and are exalted in your fleshly wisdom, bearing some Truth in the essential part, but are out of the Life and Power of all Truth: and so standing in Cains nature, your Worship is one and the same with his Offering, and so as GOD had no respect to Cain nor his Offering; neither hath he respect to your worship, being from your measures, and from that of God in you, which is pure, and being out of the life and power of God, and not being of Abels seed, which is the one Seed, which is Christ; but being one and the same with Cain, sin lies at your doors.

And so being moved by the LORD, I cannot but tell you the Truth; For if you do well, shall you not be accepted; but if you do evil sin lyeth at your door, Genesis 4.7. But being from the Light, you cannot believe the truth, though it be told you: And verily, my Spirit is grieved within me to see how your mouths sometimes runs over with the Prophets Words, CHRISTS Words, and the Apostles, and then you think you have done GOD very good Service, when alas! you are quite out of the Life, and are erred from that Spirit, which the true Prophets and Apostles were acted, led, and guided by, and are found in the enmity, and in one and the same with Cain, though outwardly you seem to be very Religious men, till you come to the tryal; but when Temptation cometh, by and by, you are offended; if any one give you the least distaste, then you shew what Seed you are of, and what Seed rules in you, then Cains nature is seen, and the enmity shewes it self, in rendring evil for evil, which is contrary to the practice of the Saints, and Servants of GOD, as the Scripture doth declare, where it saith. Render no man evil for evil: And it is contrary to the Spirit of Jesus, which the Churches was led and guided by.

And as it is written of Christ, for our example, when he was reviled, he reviled not again, but committed it to him, that judgeeth righteously. And verily, this was the sweet temper of the Saints of God, shewing forth the fruits of the Spirit, which is meekness, patience, long-suffering, gentleness, godliness, faith, love, and such like: but I say, let a Souldier, or any other give but the least distaste to any of you Officers, who are called Anabaptists, from the highest to the lowest, how do your countenances change, and how big, as I have said, you will look upon a Souldier, and Cane, and threaten to Cut him, and Cut him too sometimes; and afterward commit him to the Guard or Prison, and bear him a grudge twelve moneths after: Why verily this is Cains nature, and this is the Word of the Lord to you all, this is the enmity of the Serpent, and of his Seed you are, and under the Curse you are, and the Spirit of Christ judgeth you; but yet take notice that I do not speak against lawfull Discipline, nor against lawfull punishment, nor against lawfull correction; for the rod is for the fools back; but of the manner of it, when it is done out of malice, in your own wills, venting your spleen, and satisfying that in you which is of God (accursed.) For that in you which takes offence is for judgement, and for the wine-press of the wrath of God; and you worship without the Gate, in the Court without the Temple, which is no more to be measured, and you are ignorant, and know not the Fathers house, but are joyned to the beast and are of a beast-like nature, and in the number of her heads and horns, you stand. I cannot flatter you, nor I cannot bear any longer, I am moved to declare, to see how you are gone out from that of God in you, from the pure principle, the Light of Christ, which once moved in you against sin, and reproved you for all things that you did amiss; but you have slain the just, and murthered Gods witness in you, and are gone out from the Light, from your measures; and are eating and drinking with the drunken, and have hid your talent in the earth, and have put the Lords money to abominable use, and sad will it be with you, when your Lord returns, when the Light again shineth, and the witness of GOD, which you have slain and murthered shall arise.

Therefore consider, and return all of you, who are gone out
from the Light, and have made shipwrack of Faith, and a good Conscience; who have made it appear that you have loved a Commission and Honour more then the Lord Jesus and his way and worship, Job 20.15. and have swallowed down riches; but know this, you shall vomit them up again, God will cast them out of your bellies, if you do not speedily repent; yea verily, you cannot always go unpunished; therefore as you are gone out from GOD, and from that of GOD in you, which is pure, you may well look for judgement, and to have that of God made good upon you; where he saith, You shall flee from a Rod of Iron, and a Bow of Steel shall strike you thorow.

Therefore I say in the fear of the Lord, consider where you stand, my Spirit is grieved, I cannot hold my peace, to see how you are revolted from the highest to the lowest, and your hearts are down, and have erred from the pure principle, and the enemy of your souls have got ground and prevailed, and you lie naked and have flung away your weapons of War, you have forborn to fight, I mean not carnal Weapons, which the Lord in his time will cause to be beaten into Plough-shares, and into Pruninghooks; but I mean those weapons which are spiritual, which you flung quite away, which you once pretended you were armed with; yea you once pretended to be armed in the power of Gods might; and I have heard you exhort those that you call brethren to put on the whole armour of God, that they might be able to stand in the evil day, when the time of temptation should come; but you were but in words, you never came into the Life, though there was something of God which moved in you against sin, which you had done well if you had took heed thereunto; for that was Gods Talent which you have hid in the earth, and the Devil overcome you, before ever you come to be sensible what the Armour of God was, or where it was to be had, but you had, I say, a sufficient measure, had you took heed, to have been guided by it.
But I know you will be offended, that I should say that you never had the whole Armour of God.

Why verily, if you had it, you have now lost it, and have hid your talent in the earth: the earth is grown over it, and you cannot
tell where to finde it; for the Serpent is sprung up in you, and the Seed of GOD is overgrown and choaked in you, and that eye which should see is blinde, and that ear which should hear is deaf and stopped, and you have no eye to see with, nor no ear to hear with; but you see as the world seeth, and you hear as the world heareth, being gone out into the world from that of God which is pure, from the pure principle of Light and Life, into the Honour, Fashions, and Customs of the world, opposing those that reprove sin in the gate, who have put on that which you once pretended to have, which is the Shield of Faith, the helmet of Salvation, and the Sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God, and have their feet shod with the preparation of the gospel of peace, Ephes. 6.16. But this you never had, nor this you never put on, nor this you never come to wear; you never came into this dress to stand in the power of God, though you had a measure from God, a Light to guide you to it; but you are apostated from that you had, from the Light of Christ which was sufficient to have brought to it, but the earth I say is grown over it, and you are gone out into the world, and into the Customs and Kingdom of it, and are become one of the Heads of the Beast, and have many horns grown out of your Head; and with the Beast you push against the one Head and Horn of Gods Salvation.

Verily, I did not think at Marston Moor fight, nor severall other Engagements since, that ever any of the Innocent Lambs of God should have been beaten and put in Prison, for reproving sin in the gate; for crying out against the Ministers of Antichrist, which then with one consent we all cryed down; Who Divine for money, who preach for filthy lucre; which Jeremiah cryed out against, and said, It was an horrible filthy thing: I say, I did not think after so many Engagements, which was to the loss of so much blood, that any, I say for Conscience sake, should ever have been put in prison in the name of his Highness the Lord Protector. What is become of the thousands, and ten thousands that hath been flain, in pretence to throw down the Kingdom of Antichrist, the Beast and Beastly power, whereby many a Woman is Husbandless, and many a Childe Fatherless,
and many of us miss our Friends, who so engaged with us; but what is I say, the fruit and the effect of all our Labours? Is not all again a setting up which we then engaged with one consent to pull down, if GOD did permit? What is become of all our former Protestations and Covenants for Liberty of Conscience, and for setting up the Kingdom of Christ?

Alas! alas! you are all Apostated from the highest to the lowest, from what you were, and are gone out from the Light which you then were enlightened withal, and have given your power again to the Beast, and you are become Steeple-house hearers. Again as J have said, Thus have you failed to stand in the power of Gods might, the Devil hath made a breach upon you: and a Commission, and Honour, and the love of money, which is the root of all evil hath blinded your eye, and hath put it out, I think you do not see at all: but still take notice that I am not against Commissions, but against Corruptions, neither am I against Magistracy: nay, I do not deny to live under Government; some must Command, others must be Commanded: But this is that which I am a Witness to, and to that of GOD in your Consciences I speak, which bears Witness with me, that you are gone out from the Light, from that of GOD, which is pure: And so when Commissons and Places of Command do steal away the heart from God, and from his Light, which should lead to his way, that so you might live in his Life, which is pure, here Riches, Honours, and places of trust are all of God accursed, where it stands not in the Light and Life of God.

Therefore in the fear of the Lord, consider seeing you are gone out from the Light, and seeing it is your unhappy condition to be Apostated from that measure of God which was given you to profit withal, and so by this means you are become strangers to the life of God, walking according to the course of this world, according to the Prince of the power of the ayre, the Spirit that now worketh in the children of disobedience, Eph. 2.2. in the alienated estate without Christ, and are Aliens from the Common-wealth of Israel, and strangers from the Covenant of promise, having no hope, and without God in the world, ver. 12.
Why seeing you are thus fallen, know the day of your visitation, and return to that which moves in you against sin, which is Gods Covenant of Light, that now you who are afar off, may be made neer by the blood of Christ, and that you may be sealed with the holy Spirit of promise, Eph. 1.13. And that the eyes of your understandings may be enlightened, that ye may know what is the hope of his Calling, and what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the Saints is, and what is the exceeding greatness of his power to us ward, who believe according to the working of his mighty power, which he wrought in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, ver. 18. And verily, this is the end of my declaring, that I might bring you to be sensible of the Kingdom of heaven, and to know the little leaven that leaveneth the whole lump, and to know the grain of Mustard seed, which is the least of all seeds. Oh that I could bring you to inherit substance! that so you might have salt in your selves, and oyl in your own vessels, and have bread in your own houses. Oh that I could bring you to feel the life, to feel Christ in you, making clean your hearts! Oh that I could make you truly sensible of your measure, of that talent which you have received, and of which you must give an account of, when the good man of the house shall return, Mark 13, 33, 37. Luke 13.12. Mat. 25.14. And now that every man hath a measure from God is manifest in me, and these places of Scripture are opened in me, which was once a mysterie to me, and are yet a mysterie to the world, and to all the children of darkness. Why? I say be not deceived by any means, for you have all a talent, and you are all lighted with the Light of CHRIST, as I in my measure have declared, and by the Scriptures of Truth proved.

Therefore, I say, go not forth, but know Christ is neer for he is not far from every one of us, Acts 17.27. He whose name is called the word of God, Rev. 19. is very nigh unto thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart, that thou mayest do it, Deut. 30.14. And it is written, the righteousness which is of faith, speaketh on this wise, Say not in thine heart, who shall ascend into heaven, that is, to bring Christ down from above, or who shall descend into the deep, that is, to bring Christ again from the dead: But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy
heart, that is the word of Faith which we preach, Rom. 10.6.7.

Therefore I say, wait to feel the Resurrection of the seed, and then all Christs Parables will be opened in you, and you shall come to know that mysterie which is hid from the world from the Natural mans wisdom, though he be wise and prudent; nay, verily the wise men after the flesh, though they can speak all Languages, yet they cannot reach to Gods witness, to the pearl of great price, but remain ignorant of the white stone, and the new Name written in it, which no man knows but him that hath it.

And now briefly to conclude, I shall as it is made out in me, declare the mystery of the Parables which Christ put forth to his Disciples, which are mentioned in the Evangelists, Matthew, Mark, and Luke, whereby I shall prove that every man that cometh into the world hath a sufficient measure from Christ, which if improved, no man need to perish from the presence of the Father; and yet Free-will denyed, and Will-worship excluded.

It is written, The Kingdom of heaven, is as a man travelling into a far Country, who called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods, and unto one he gave five Talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his severall ability, and strait way took his journey, Matth. 25.14.

And in Mark it is written thus, The Son of man, is as a man taking a far journey, who left his house, and gave authority to his servants and to every man his work, and commanded the Porter to watch, Mark 13.34.

And in Luke 13. and the 18. then said Christ, Vnto what is the kingdom of God like, and whereunto shall I resemble it: saith he, It is like a grain of Mustard seed, which a man took, and east into his Garden, and it grew and waxed a great Tree and the Fowls of the ayr lodged in the branches of it. And in ver. 20. and again he said, Whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of God, it is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal till the whole was leavened: From which Parable thus put forth by Christ, the sum and substance of the Masters goods, with the grain
of mustard-seed, and leaven cast into the three measures of meal; and thus I prove it to those that believe, but to the unbeliever it is still a parable.

This I say, is the sum, and the substance, and the word of the Lord to all Professors in the world, that the Masters goods, the grain of Mustard seed, and leaven, that every man hath a measure of, that cometh into the world, is a measure of the eternal Spirit of the Father, called the Son of God, which was once crucified in the flesh, but ever liveth in Spirit, him by whom the world was made, and by whom we live, and move, and have our being; and the whole world, I say, hath a measure of this eternal being of the Father, called the Son, and called the holy Ghost, and the holy Spirit, a measure of which moveth in all the Sons and Daughters of Adam against sin, and would not that any should perish, but that the wicked should turn from his wayes and live, Ezek. 33.11.

But the Masters goods, the grain of Mustard seed, and the leaven, the lost groat, and the pearl of great price, is a figure, and but a figure of the eternal Spirit of the Father, which was manifested in the childe Jesus, and is now manifested in his Servants the children of Light, a measure of which Light and Spirit moves in all the world against sin, as I have said; and as every one yields obedience to the actings and movings of it, which is the creatures power, and which excludes Free-will and will-worship; and so by the power of God, and not by the power of the Creature is he led out of sin thereby: so that I say, the Light and Spirit of the eternal Father, a measure of it moves in every one, which is his ability, who have not slain this just principle; therefore I say, that which moves in you against sin is Gods Covenant of Light, which is your measure, power and strength, and Gods witness which he hath placed in every one, in the Male, and in the Female, which is thy strength, and the strength of every man which to it keeps; so that he that keeps to his measure, walks in the Light, and there is no occasion of stumbling in him; for he that walks in the light, keeps in his measure, which is the power of God, and so this witness of God which moves in every one against sin, brings to the sight of sin, and as every one doth bring his deeds to the light, and as he turns into the witness of God, he
shall be brought into Judgement, and there he must abide till he be refined and purified as silver and gold is purified; for verily, this must all come to, that come to a perfect State in Christ; yea Zion shall be redeemed through judgement, and her converts with righteousness, Isaiah 1.27. and in Mount Zion shall be deliverance, and there shall be holiness, and the house of Jacob shall be a fire, and the house of Joseph a flame, and the house of Esau for stubble; and they shall kindle in them and devour them, and there shall not be any remaining of the house of Esau for the Lord hath spoken it; and Saviours shall come up on Mount Zion to judge the mount of Esau, and the Kingdom shall be the Lords, Obad. 17.21.

And now as every one doth keep to the witness of God in him he shall come to feel the fire of God burning, as long as there is any of Esaus nature standing; for in the light must that nature receive its sentence; but as every one keeps to the witness, to that of God which condemns for sin, you shall come to feel the power of God, and to witness a victory over sin and death, and then this witness of God which condemns for sin will justifie from sin, and as every one keeps to his measure, to that of God which moves against sin, he shall be kept from sin, for it is the present help and power against sin.

And the witness of God is slain in the murtherer, before he commit murther, and in the adulterer before he commit adultery, and in the Ranter, and in every wicked Reprobate who knows not, who believes not, nor feels not the quickening Spirit, but have crucified the Lord of Glory: Christ was crucified in the flesh but once upon the Cross, but he hath been often crucified and slain in the hearts of the sons of men: therefore let all Ranters, and wicked debaucht persons, who have given up themselves to work wickedness, know what it is to crucifie the Son of God afresh, and to put him to an open shame Heb. 6.

And this I am moved to declare, for your sakes, who are called Anabaptists, who are not only from your measures, from the light and spirit, but deny it, that you may come to know, and feel, and to be a witness of that Divine being which moves in all men against sin: and would not that any should perish, but would
that all men should turn to that of God in them, which is a pure measure given for every one to profit withal; therefore know your measure, know Gods Covenant of Light, know the Immortal Seed, the Word which was from the beginning Christ Jesus; the rock of Ages, which was before Abraham was, which is able to save all that turn their minds inward, to finde him in his Temple: And now I hope for time to come, you will not be so audacious as to deny your measure; to deny Gods Witness, for that there is a seed in all, a light in all, a measure of God, the power of God, by which, and in which, all are to minde, and to take heed to, as a sufficient guide at all times, and not to stir, nor move without it: for whosoever goes from that of God, or before it, or without it, and its moving, goeth in their own wils, and whether they Plough, Preach, or Pray, God accepts them not.

And now that there is a Light in all, a measure in all, a seed in all, I have proved from Scripture, all a long in this little Treatise; and shall further prove, that God hath sowed good seed in all the children of men. It is written, saith the Lord, O ye inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah, judge I pray you between me and my vineyard, what could I have done more to my vineyard, that I have not done unto it, Isaiah 5.3. and in Mat. 13.24. Its manifest that he hath sowed good seed in his field, which is all the world: yea, I say God hath given to every one a portion to Trade with, he hath sowed good seed in all, and verily he doth expect fruit: yea, saith the Servants, thou sowest good seed in thy Field, from whence then hath it tares. And under the similitude of the Vine, he describeth the unfruitfull state of the Inhabitants of Jerusalem and Judah. Now will I sing to my beloved a Song of my beloved, touching his vineyard. My wel beloved hath a vineyard in a very fruitfull hill and he fenced it, and gathered out the stones thereof, and planted it with the choicest vine and built a tower in the midst of it and also made a wine-press therein, and he looked that it should bring forth grapes, and it brought forth wilde grapes; And what could I have done more for my vineyard, then I have done: And now go to, I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard, saith the Lord, I will take away the hedge thereof, and it shall be eaten up; and break down the wall thereof, and I will lay it waste, and I will no more manure it: The vineyard of the Lord of hosts,
is the house of Israel, and the men of Judah his pleasant plants: and he looked for Judgement, but behold oppression! For righteousness, but behold a cry! Isaiah 5.

And this let all men know, that God hath appointed a day, in which he will judge the world in righteousness, when as the unprofitable servants who have hid their talents in the earth, shall be called to accompt, & every man shall receive according as is meet: Therefore saith Christ, Watch ye for ye know not when the master of the house cometh, at even or at midnight, or at the Cock crowing, or in the morning, least coming suddenly he finde you sleeping; and what I say unto you, I say unto all, Watch, Mark 35. Yea verily, the Lord will come, and an harvest there shall be, when as the Lord will say to the Reapers, Gather ye first the tares, and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather my wheat into my garner; but burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire. And now in the fear of the Lord, consider where you stand; for you are as yet from your measures from that of God in you which is pure, acting in the other seed, as I have said. (For mind) the Tree is known by the Fruit, and the root is known by the blade, that springs from it: indeed you do profess Religion in words, and talk of Christ, and his kingdom without you: But the kingdom of heaven doth not consist in words, but in righteousness and peace, and joy in the holy Ghost; which you who are called Anabaptists, are not as yet come unto; who cannot witness a bridle to your tongues, who are not come to yea and nay, neither can you be perswaded to wait in silence, to receive power from God. Nay say you, there is no edification in that: why in the fear of the Lord consider, that unless you come solemnly to wait upon God in the death of words; yea verily, unless you come to be silent, and solemnly to wait upon God, you will never be brought out of your own wills, nor wilworship, to worship God in Spirit and Truth, but will remain ignorant of the Sabbath of the Lord; in which we are not to speak our own words, nor think our own thoughts. Those that know the Sabbath of the Lord, and the true Rest, and the true Worship of GOD, must not speak their own words, nor think their own thoughts.

And this is the word of the Lord to you all, be silent when you are met together, and turn your mindes inward to the light of
Christ which moveth in you against sin, by it to be directed, if ever you minde to come to know Christ neer you, and in you; and if you look for salvation by Christ, you must know Christ neer you, and in you, or else you are Reprobates; and this is the word of the Lord to you all, and to all people, that if Christ be not in you, the Devil is in you; and if Christ do not rule in you, the Devil ruleth in you, and is King in your hearts, and you are carried captive at his will, though he suffer you to worship in your own wils, he matters not that, because he knows that GOD regards it not: and herein he hath blinded your eye, in that you think you have done God good Service, when as you have been Praying and Preaching, or Disputing some part of a day in your own wils; and after you have done are exalted in your own wisdom, which is sensual and devilish, and which is foolishness with God, and that which he will destroy. But now if you come to a death in words for a little time solemnly to wait upon God in the Light which you are lighted withall, which light moveth in you against sin, and tells you all things that even you have done amiss, that you might do so no more; this that tells you this, is the Light of CHRIST, and your measure which is given you to profit withal; this is the substance of the Figure, the grain of Mustadr seed, which is the least of all seeds; and this is the Leaven Christ spoke of which leaveneth the whole lump: this is the pearl of great price; the lost groat, and the Talent which the unprofitable Servant hid in the earth, and this is that which makes them for ever happy that hath it; but this is that which all the world is ignorant of notwithstanding it is in them to be found; and it is in them sometimes felt; but none ever came to enjoy it but as they turne their mindes inward to the Light of Christ: which Light if believed in, and obeyed and followed, would bring you to this Pearl of great price, which is Christ in us the hope of glory, which is the sum and substance of all Types and Figures, and Shadows where he is manifested within felt, and witnessed; and those alone inherit substance and are clean through the word, and are come to the blood of cleansing, and to the Spirits of just men made perfect, whereas you that are called Anabaptists, who deny the Light, and the Spirit of CHRIST within you
to be your Teacher and Guide; you are blinde and know nothing, but are from your measure, and so you worship in your own wills, and not in the power of GOD; but ye are carnal and ignorant, and know not Gods treasure, the Pearl of great price, which is the anointing of the Father, and so having no salt in your selves, your worship is unsavoury, and you come under the notion of the unprofitable Servant (as I have said) who have hid his Lords mony, yea the Lords treasure is hid in the earth, and the earth is grown over it; and is become corrupt: for where the Lords treasure is not felt and witnessed, the earth is unclean, and there is an evil treasure, from whence proceeds lying and all manner of abominations. And it is written, The good man out of the good treasure of his heart, bringeth forth good fruit and the wicked man out of the evil treasure of his heart, bringeth forth evil fruit: Such as is the treasure, such is that which proceeds from it; and as is the tree, such is the fruit, and as is the root such are the branches thereof.

Therefore I beseech you read and consider your own estates, and know this that your fruits discover what root you are of, and whose children you are; therefore consider your folly you vain bablers; were all your vain and idle words writ in a Book, and laid before you (that you speak in one year?) And were your eye open to see them, you would be ashamed of them, nay it would be the saddest Book that ever your eyes did behold, and it will be a sad day with you when you shall come to read your evil thoughts and deeds, not of a year, but of many years; & such a Book I assure you, you must all read within you, sooner or latter, when the Good man of the house returneth to call you to account: Alas! alas! what do you differ from the world in these things? It is true, I cannot accuse you of swearing, unless it be some small petty oath or so; but for foolish mirth, and foolish jestings, idle & vain words, there is little or no difference between those whom you call the world, and your selves, whom you count that ye are Christians; and this ye will come to see, if ever you turn your minds inward to the Light, which at present you minde not, and all this springs from an evil root in you, from the evil treasure of your hearts and the Lords treasure is not felt, nor witnessed in you, and so you are worshipping the unknown God ignorantly in your
own wills, bearing the true Prophets words, Christs words, and the Apostles, in your aiery, earthly minds and understandings; but are out of the life, and possess nothing of substance, whose hearts are barren, and unfruitfull, and so are setled upon the Lees in a dead formality, feeding upon husks, upon the Prodigals food, whereby your souls are pined and starved, and are ready to die the death of deaths, being from the true food, and from the light which directs to it.

Oh blinde deceived Spirits! who are from the Light, and out of the life, and in the filth of the world, in the lusts of the flesh, in the lusts of the eye, and in the pride of life, which is not of the Father, but of the world: following the fashions thereof, and living in the deceit thereof; sporting your selves in the day time, mockers and scoffers, who are grown wanton, and will bring Scripture to plead for sin; for which deceit and hypocrisie I have been sometimes moved to reprove you for: For which you swell and look big, whereby you discover your selves to be of Esau's nature, and in the enmity of Cain, and the Serpents head not broken; and so discover your selves to be that seed which the Promise is not too, but the curse of the Lord is upon. Therefore in the fear of the Lord, turn your mindes inward to the light of Christ, which moveth in you against sin; that the seed, which the promise is to may be raised in you, and that a birth born from above, you may come to witness in you, which the gates of Hell shall not prevail against.

And this is my counsell that ye wait to feel Gods living presence in you, which is a quickening Spirit, which where it is felt and witnessed, it slayeth the enmity, and breaketh the Serpents head: which if you come not to witness done in you, ye are bastards and not sons; and a bastard hath no right to the inheritance. Wo be to that Birth that is brought forth, and not rightly begotten! Wo be to that birth, and to that seed, which calls God Father, and were never begotten by him, neither are obedient to him. Wo be to him, that is to forward, that runs, and was not sent, who cannot witness a measure of the eternal Spirit, of the Father; these go before they are sent, and these are those that God hath not spoken to at all: these are thieves and robbers, that come before Christ, and talks of GOD, and of Christ; and say, they are the children
and Church of God; and say the Lord saith, when as he hath not spoken to them at all: but in your own imaginations, and in your own wills, and faln wisdom, and in your first nature which is unclean, and of God accursed: do you use your tongues, and say that you are the Church and people of God, but are not washed from your uncleanness, and yet stand upon your Creature-righteousness, but cannot witness a measure of the eternal Spirit of the Father: but are ignorant of GODS treasure as I have said.

Why wo be those that say they are Ministers of Christ, and know not Gods treasure! and speak not from Gods treasure from the anointing: Wo be to them, who have not the witness in themselves! Wo to those that go out for help! Wo be to them that go down into Egypt for food! Wo to those that have not bread in their own houses! Wo be to them who Profess, and possess not! Wo be to them that have not oyl in their own vessels! and whose Lamps are not burning when the Bride-groom cometh! Wo be to those that are gone out from their measure, from that of GOD in them which is pure! looking for a Christ to come in the clouds without them, and know not Christ come in the clouds within them! Why in the fear and dread of the living GOD of Life, and Power, and Righteousness, a measure of which moveth in all the world against sin and a measure of the eternal Spirit of the Father, you that are called Anabaptists must come to witness, or else you are Reprobates. Therefore, I say, in the fear of the Lord turn your mindes inward to the Light, that ye may know the true treasure, the pearl of great price, the grain of Mustard seed, which is the least of all seeds, and the tryed stone, and the chief Corner stone, elect and precious, which you Builders have rejected, which is become the head of the Corner, neither is their salvation in any other, which is set for the fall, and for the rising again of many in Israel and to this must you all come, to this must you all stoop: yea at the name of Jesus, Every knee shall bow, and all tongues shall confess to God, in the day of his power.

Therefore come down ye tall Cedars, and bow to the Light of Christ, which moveth in you against sin: Oh you lofty Oaks! yea. I say venture to fall upon this stone that you may be broken, which if you refuse to do, & it fall upon you, it will grinde you to powder.

Therefore in the feare of the Lord consider Oh yee lofty ones! and stoope yee stout-hearted, kisse the Son least he be angry and you perish when his wrath is kindled but a little; yea I say and you perish from the presence of the eternall God, who desireth not the death of a sinner but rather that the wicked should turne from his wayes and live.

Therefore in love to your precious, soules I exhort you to search low in your selves that you may find Gods treasure and come to witness his living presence and power in you, which when you feel it, it will make you cleane, and bring you to the perfect state as I have said, therefore in the deniall of your own wisdome, which is sensuall and divelish, and in the light of Christ which is your measure and your strength, and moveth in you against sin, why I say bee silent and speake not at all, but forbeare to mention the name of God for a little time, and wait in that which moveth in you against sin; and that will in time give you power over sin and death: and as you wait in the light and yeild obedience to it, God will give power, to his witness which you have slaine in you which is spiritually called Sodom and Egypt: or outward Court or carnall state of flesh where Christ our Lord was crucified; yea I say be silent speake not, nor goe not forth, to aske counsell of any, but wait in that which moves in you against sin, till yee feel Gods power and till you are sencible, that there is something brought forth in you which is pure, and which hath changed your hearts and subdued your lusts and hath slaine the enmity and hath broken the Serpents head, and bound the strong man armed and cast him out and all the workes of the Divell destroyed, and destroying.

Thus if you will be sober minded and forbeare going forth and solemnly wait upon GOD till you receive power from God to seeke to God, for God will be found of his owne seed and not of any other, God will be found of that which is of himselfe; which is begotten of him, and brought forth in the light, yea to that birth hath God respect which is of himselfe, which is borne from above, yea those that seeke him here, shall find him, those that seeke him is a measure of himselfe shall find him and none else; for God is pure and nothing can reach to him, nor prevaile with him, but that which is pure.

Therefore (I say) be silent yee vaine bablers who have been so long talking of a Christ without you, at a distance from you, and know not Christ formed in you, but deny the light and oppose the Spirit, why know this that hee that hath not the Spirit is none of his, and as many as are Sons God hath sent the spirit of his Son into their hearts, whereby they cry Abba Father, and those I say that are not Sons are bastards, and those that have not the spirit of Christ are none of his but have the spirit of the world, and the spirit of the world is a lying Spirit which abode not in the truth; and woe be to that Spirit which is out of the truth! And woe be to those that are covered with a covering and not with the Spirit of the Lord, woe be to those that are looking for CHRIST beyond the Seas and above the Stars, and know him not to be nere even in his Temple in flesh, 2 Cor. 6.16. Examine your selves whether yee be in the Faith, prove your own selves, know yee not that Jesus Christ is in you except yee are reprobates; the Apostles and other believers did see CHRIST and knew him after the flesh, but saith the Apostle henceforth know we no man after the flesh; though we have knowne Christ after the flesh, yet henceforth know we him so no more; therefore I say be silent and sober minded and wait to know Christ neere you and in you, for though Christ did offer up himselfe upon the Cross, and was a sufficient sacrifice in which God was well pleased, yet shall it availe you nothing; unlesse yee pertake of his Resurrection; that is unless you come to witness Christ risen from the dead, and ascended and sitting at the right hand of God in heaven in you, there bearing rule and authority; for all the Saints did witnesse this; yea I say all the Saints, that ever was gathered, that were Disciples indeed, and all the Saints that are now gathered, were then, and are now, the temple of God; so it is written know yee not that yee are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you; if any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy, for the temple of God is holy, which temple yee are, let no man deceive himselfe, if any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world let him become a Foole that hee may be wise, for the wisdome of this world is foolishnesse with God, for it is written Hee taketh the wise in their owne craftiness, 1 Corinth. 3.16.

And it is written, That the unrighteous shall not inherit the Kingdom of God, be not deceived neither Fornicators, nor adulterers, nor effeminates, nor abusers of themselves with mankind, nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor extortioners shall inherit the kingdom of God: And such were some of you (and now I come to that which makes for my purpose;) but ye are washed but ye are sanctified, but ye are justified, in the name of the Lord Jesus, and by the Spirit of our God, 1 Cor. 6.11. And this is that which I would have you to minde, that it is the Spiritual presence of Christ, where he is felt and witnessed, that saveth and sanctifieth, and that cleanseth, as in the fore cited place; and Ephes. 5.5. so that we are still to minde that there is no salvation; but where Christ is witnessed in Spirit: And so those that are not led by the Spirit are unclean, and all things are unclean unto them, even their holy things as they call them; for those that cannot witness a measure of Gods Spirit to lead and to carry them forth are unclean in all their performances, and go forth in their own wills, and those that are from the Light and Spirit of Christ, are from their measures, out of the power of GOD, and stand in their first Nature, in the Fall, which is a state of enmity, and uncleanness, and they that are there cannot please God, whether they Plough or pray.

And out of this state can no man come in his own will, but as he doth believe in the Light which doth move in him, against sin which is his measure, and which is given to every man to profit withal; so that every man that believeth in the Light, and walketh in it, he stands in his measure, and walketh, and worshippeth in the power of God; and here those that seek God finde him, and those that knock it is opened unto them, and those that seek in the Light, seek in the power of God, and those alone are they which finde wisdom, and the hidden treasure: yea verily, If in the light of Christ, you seek for wisdom as silver, and search for her as for hid treasures, then shall you understand the fear of the Lord, and finde the knowledge of thy God, for the Lord giveth wisdom; out of his mouth cometh knowledge and understanding; he layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous, he is a Buckler to those that walk uprightly: And Gods wisdom is contrary to the worlds wisdom; it is of another nature, it is pure and eternal, and is above
the world, and confounds the wisdom of the world; the wisdom of the world is foolishness with GOD: so that birth which is brought forth in the Light, in the wisdom of God is pure and perfect, contrary, I say, to that of the world, it is gentle, kinde, and courteous, easie to be intreated, it saith no ill, nor doth no ill, nor thinketh no ill; and this is the Birth that seeks, and finds, and knocks, and it is opened unto it strait wayes; and here is the ear that heareth, and the eye that seeth, and the heart that understandeth right things: this is the seed that the Promise is too; but the world that is from the light, and out of the pure wisdom of God is froward and passionate, and unclean, having eyes and see not, ears, and hear not, those things which be eternal: and now he that hath an ear to hear let him hear what the power speaketh.

IT is written, That God made man upright, but he hath sought out many inventions, yea and the whole world lyeth in wickedness, and is estranged from God, and is in a state of uncleanness; whereupon saith Job, Who then can be justified, &c. How can he be clean that is born of a woman? And saith he, What is man that he should be clean, and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous? And saith David, Behold, I was shapen in iniquity, and in sin did my mother conceive me. And saith Job, Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean, (nay not one;) for the first man is of the earth earthy: yea, this is the condition of all men in the fall, they are gone out from God, and from the Law which is light, and are become strangers to the life of God; and are dead in trespasses and in sins, this is mans condition in the Fall, and all men are unclean till they come to witness the quickening Spirit, and are made partakers of the Covenant which is Light: yea, I say, in a state of uncleanness are all men by Nature, none excepted.

And in this Rate do you stand who are called Anabaptists, who
are from the light, and guidance of the Spirit of Christ, and have the world in your hearts and in the lusts of it doe you live, and in the fashion of it you goe imitating the world in this fashion, and the other fashion, which is contrary to the counsell of the Apostles, who lived in the pure life out of the fashions of the world; yea I say contrary to the counsell of Paul, who was a true Minister of Christ doe you walke; for saith hee, fashion not your selves like unto this world; for all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, the lust of the Eye, and the pride of life, is not of the father, but of the world, and saith he, the world passeth away, and the lusts thereof shall have an end. Therefore consider and see the vanity of your minds, how you are lifted up with Pride, and how farre you are from the life of God, not having power to governe your owne house, you are uncapable to take care of the Church of God; nay verily you are but talkers of the Church, talkers of the Saints conditions, for you are farre unlike the Church and Saints of God, a Saint is a high word, it signifies Sanctity, the Saints were sanctified, they had received the true Faith which purified their hearts, and they were cleane through the word; and their hearts were sprinkled from an evill Conscience, and their bodies washed with pure water: They were made cleane I say through the word and the word of God did abide in them, which made them cleane, and kept them cleane and free from those spots, and wrinckles, and blemishes which you who are called Anabaptists are stained with; and especially some of you in the Army, who are turned from the grace of God into wantonness, whereby you have slaine the just, and crucified the Son of God a fresh, and put him to an open shame, yea I say they that have turned from the grace of God into wantonness, have slaine the just and are from that of God in them which is pure, and in this state I say doe you Baptists stand, who are found in the worlds fashion and in their vaine communications, who are found in the idle foolish talking and jesting, and sporting; sitting downe to eate and rising up to play: Alas! alas! how are you gone out into the pollutions of the world, how are yee degenerated from what you were formerly as I have said; why verily it was otherwise with us heretofore, we were wont to be glad to make use of any opportunity, if it were but in the field, or upon a Guard, we would be
speaking one to another of those things which concerned the honour of God, and our everlasting peace.

And verily I can now witness, that there was some thing of God in us which moved in us against sin, which since we have degenerated from and gone out, from that of God which is pure; yea you are alienated from the life of God; for no sooner now, can we mount a guard, but presently say you, come? What shall doe? what play shall we goe too? Shall we cast a Bell? Or shall we goe to Iacke of all trades? let us goe to some thing to drive away the time? and so hy-goe-mad! out of one vaine exercise into another; and you that are Officers, are as bad as others! in giving your consents, and in suffering such a noise, as if it were a Bearebaiting; and for the lawfulness of it, you that are Baptists will bring Scripture to plead for it, and make Salomon your Author for your madnesse, and folly, Notwithstanding he saith of Laughter it is madnesse, and of mirth what doth it, and saith hee, sorrow is better then laughter, for by the sadness of the Countenance the heart is made better; and saith hee, the heart of the wise is in the house of mourning, but the song of fooles is in the house of mirth, and in this you manifest your selves to come short of the Scribes and Pharisees and hypocrites, who made cleane the out side, but you come short in this.

And now turn your minds into the light, and it will let you see your folly, yea I apply my self, to that of God in you to the light of Christ which moveth in you against sin, to beare witness with me, for God, and against you, that you are wicked and vaine, and out of the pure life, and savour not the things of God, whose conversations is as aforesaid, who live in wantonness, and in pride, and though you are of the poorer sort, yet you will endeavour to go in the fashion, with the rich; yea though thou art but a Foot Souldier, and not so much as a Trade to trust to when thou givest over being a souldier, yet some of you will wear your cuffs & bands, of the fashion, tied with great Ribbons: and your proud City Dames, who are Baptists are so proud, that they go mincing with their feet, & cannot tel what to eat, nor what to drink, nor what apparel to wear, good cloth is not sufficient, nor wil not serve, nor satisfie their lust, unless it be laid with silver & gold lace; and for matter of housholdstuff, you must have such a thing as your neighbor, Mr. such a one, or Mrs. such a one hath, when as in the country you have John such a one, or Mary
such a one, go in a plain dress, and are called Gaffer and Gammer, though I approve not of the term, it being Heathenish: but that which I mind is, there is more humility in them then in you; for they would not take it well of any that should call them, or do sometimes call them Master and Masters, when as one of their estates is worth an hundred of some of yours here in the City, who would be, and are a scorned, if you are not called Master and Mistris. Oh blinde deceived spirits! who are in the lusts of the flesh the lusts of the eye, and in the pride of life, which is of God accursed, and yet you lay it not to heart: Why this is the state of the wicked, this is the unclean state, wherein men have erred from that of God in them which is pure, and are in a perishing condition.

Therefore in the fear of the Lord, turn your minds in ward to the Light of Christ, that so you may see your spots, and may be made clean: when shall it once be? For it is in vain for you to profess Religion, so long as you are not washed from your uncleanness but walk in the filthy wayes of the world; and in vain do you bear the Prophets words, Christ words, and the Apostles, being erred from the Light and out of the Life, which gave forth the Scriptures: you do but catch at the shadow, and get the shell, but miss the substance: yea, you being out of the Life; you bear but a false sound, because you have not the true savour of the things of God: but being from the Light and guidance of the Spirit; the wrong part, the wrong nature, the fleshly wisdom, which is sensual and divelish, hath got the true Declaration, which was given forth by the holy men of God, who received the Holy Ghost, and gave forth from the gift of the Holy Ghost, which was lost at the coming in of the Apostacy, as I have said and which you have not as yet received; because you never waired for it, as those did, who had it in the old time; nor as the Apostles did, and as others do now, who witness it again received, and in the same, and from the same Light and Spirit, do now declare, whereas you in your own wills, are rangling and jangling, and disputing one with another, falling out, and quarrelling about the Letter; but being erred from the Light, and out of the Life, which gave forth the Scriptures, you savour not the things of the Spirit of God, as I have said, and so the Spirit of truth is not discerned by you; and so by it, you are
not led and guided, but have gotten the Scriptures by road (as we use to say to little children when they name their Letters, and look off from their Books) so you are talking of the Scriptures of truth which were given forth by the Spirit of truth, which is but a Declaration of the truth, and so being from the Light, take the shadow for the substance; the Scriptures for the word of God, and for that word of Life, which is but a declaration of the life, which the holy men of God felt in them; from which life in them felt gave forth a declaration of it; but this is a mysterie to you Baptists, and to all that be from the light of Christ, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world, and will be a mysterie to you, till that you yield obedience to it, and come to feel the Life which makes every heart clean, where it is witnessed. But you that are talking of a word without you; and do not feel the operation of it in your hearts, are unclean untill now, and are nigh unto cursing.

And what now? would you be compared to the Saints and Church of God! and are nothing like them (for there is this difference, they spake and gave forth as they were moved by the holy Ghost, and you speak what you have learned in the Letter:) but are ignorant of the Holy Ghost; nay, but I shall compare you to that you are like, that is to the synagogue of Satan, who say you are Saints, but are not, but do lye; for you are one of those many heads and horns of the beast, and are kin to the scarlet coloured whore, which sits upon many waters, and says in her heart, she is a Queen and no Widow, and shall see no sorrow, whose sorrows will both come in one day, unless you repent and return to the Light, from which you have erred, and now disown: Therefore I say, have a care you partake not off her plagues, whose sins reach up to heaven: and I would not have you deceive your selves any longer, not to cheat your selves of that inheritance, which may be had, though hid with God in Christ from the world, and from you, so long as you are in the state of unbelief.
But now, if you say, wherein, or in what are we like unto the Beast? Or how do we resemble her? Or how do you prove us unclean? To which I Answer.

And to that of God in your Consciences, I apply to bear witness
for God with me; for if I reach not to the witnesse of God in you, my labour is lost, and you will reape no benefit by what I have said; yet mind and consider what I have said, and what J have yet to say and you shall see that you are one of those many Heads, and many horns of the Beast, and that you do belong to the Beast, and to the Whore which sitteth upon many waters (as thus) you say that you are the Church of God; but say you, to meet together, and to be silent we cannot edifie one another, and say you to wait upon God and not to speake one to another cannot profit one another, which in so saying you prove your selves to be beasts, in saying the guift of God is not to be attained to, by waiting for; when as it is not to be attained to but by waiting for, as I have proved by the Scriptures of truth in my former discourse, and so I shall not give you those Scriptures againe; but the least Child of light doth judge you to be beasts who say; you are the Church of God and yet deny their practice, whose usuall order was to meet together and waite till something was revealed, and till moved by the life of God, and then they spoke, to the edifying of the body, but if nothing was revealed, there was nothing spoken, nor none did speake till moved by the Holy Ghost; but I say the usuall order of the Church when they were met together was to wait to receive their daily bread, and so did sweetly feed upon the bread of life and feele the sweet well-springs of God, and draw water out of the well of Salvation; when as you like beasts feed upon husks, and are satisfied with the shadow of things without life: and know not the greene pastures nor the still waters where Christ feeds his flocke in the Coole of the day, but like beasts feed in the troubled waters, wrangling and jangling one with another about that in which there is no profit; and are not you beasts? which feed and are satisfied with things that are dead and without life, who are from the light and guidance of the Spirit, and know not the truth as it is in IESVS: And I deale plainly and honestly with you in telling you the truth, for you are I say from the light from that of God in you which is pure, which never consented to sin, and so you are unlike the Church of God, and like the Church of Sardis who had a name that they lived but was dead and like the Church of the Laodeceans, who said they were rich and increased with Goods, and knew not they were poore, and wretched and misetable,
and blind and naked, whom God said he would spew out of his mouth; And you that are from your measures from that of God which is pure and eternall I cannot write to you, nor of you as spirituall, but as carnall, who are in the vaine janglings, and in strife about words; so it is written of the Church of Corinth, For ye are yet earnal; for whereas there is among you envyings and strifes, and divisions; are ye not earnal and walk as men, for why one saith, I am of Paul, ond another of Apollo: Are ye not carnal? 1 Cor. 3.3. This is your state, you are like these, and take those of the Churches which was disorderly for your ruse to walk by, and say it cannot be otherwise; nay say you, the Church of God cannot be perfect, and in this you are beasts and plead for sin, and against perfection, because there was some in the Churches that was like you, that was from that of God in them, which was pure, which would have brought them to the perfect state in Christ, had they been obedient to it, but because there was failings among some; therefore say you, none can be perfect; and yet Paul preached to present all men perfect in Christ, that he might present them without spot or wrinkle, or any such thing: and, saith he, speaking of Christ, As is he, so are we, in this world; and so of the beastly power you are, who say you are the Church of God, and yet plead for sin, and against perfection, because you love your lusts, and are not willing to submit to the pure yoke of Christ, which all must do and take up the cross to their own wils, or else you cannot be his Disciples.

And so forget not what I have said (but still minde) that there is a measure of that which is eternal in every one, in the male and in the female, which is given for every one to profit withal, and as every one doth take heed thereto, they shall come to know the Judgement Seat of Christ, and to know the unclean nature judged out, and that which is too forward to be judged down; and that which is pure of God will come to be felt and witnessed; and so as every one keeps to the light, they shall see sin in its first conception, and so the witness of God will judge that down, and judge it out that it shall never come to the birth, it shall never be brought forth into action: And now as every one doth minde the light, and is watchful, they shall see and discern the thief, the
first nature, the fleshly wisdom, which stealeth the true Prophets words, and boasteth, and is exalted: yea is in the exaltation; as there is that which is too forward in every one, that are from the light, and from their measure, which runs before it is sent and this is your condition, who are called Anabaptists, you have got the words, and are talking of the Saints conditions, and calling your selves the Church of Christ; but are not purged from your filthyness, but are praying and preaching in your first natures, and your Iusts not subdued, the enmity not slain, nor the Serpents head broken in any one of you.

Therefore I say, turn your minds inward to the light of Christ, which will let you see the Judgement-Seat, which you must all come to know and feel, the fire of Gods vengeance upon that nature, to burn and consume up all your Tin, Wood, Hay, and Stubble, before ever you can be of that Church, which God owns; which Christ is head of: And this know, that nothing shall enter into the holy City, which is unclean, or that worketh, or that maketh a lye: Nay, God doth not regard the unclean birth, to it he will not look; but (saith he) to that man will I look, who is of a broken and contrite spirit, aad trembleth at my word. Truly God is good to Israel, even to such as are of a clean heart: Therefore wash you, make you clean, put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes, cease to do evil, learn to do well, and think not that God is served with vain words; nay verily, he is weary of them, as ever he was with the fat of Rams, so long as you live in your sins, and do not bring forth the fruits of righteousness.

To what purpose is the multitude of your Sacrifices unto me, saith the Lord, I am full of the burnt offerings of rams, and the fat of fed beasts, and I delight not in the blood of Bullocks, or of Lambs, or of hee Goats, saith the LORD. Therefore in the dread of God, consider your idle talk; consider how idly you spend your time all the week, you that are Souldiers, in wanton sports, which hath stollen away your hearts, and your minds are out from that of God in you, which is pure, and which never consents to sin, as I have said, 〈◊〉 you are found in the impure Language: no difference between you, and those whom you call the world; and yet upon the first day of the week you word it in your
several Meetings, who have been all the week besides taking your pleasures, and fulfilling your lusts.

And this is the word of the LORD to you all, To what purpose is the multitude of your Sacrifices, to what purpose is the multitude of your Prayers and Sermons, and to what end do you Dip and break Bread and drink Wine: to what end do you walk in Ordinances, as you call them and are not washed from your uncleanness, but bring forth the fruits of unrighteousness. Why? even your Assemblings God cannot away with, it is iniquity; even your solemn Meetings: Therefore stay your minds in the light of Christ, which moveth in you against sin, and bring all your evil deeds to the light, that upon the Judgment Seat, and by Gods righteous Judgment passing upon your sins, you may be redeemed; for Zion must be redeemed through Judgement, as I have said.

And now take notice, in this I do not deny the day of Judgment hereafter, because I would have you bring your deeds to the light, that you may be judged and redeemed here, that so you may not be condemned, and perish at the last day; for you that do not know a Judgement there, and a Redemption here, and a Resurrection here, you shall never know Salvation hereafter: if you be not made clean through the word, and sanctification of the Spirit here, you shall not be saved hereafter; those that do not in the light come to witness a measure of that which is eternal of God in them, and though at the first it appear but small, even as the least grain of mustard seed, which is the least of all seeds: If you do not feel it, and if it do not wax and grow to a great Tree in you you are unprofitable servants, and do hinder the growth of it, by keeping it too low in the earth.

And this is the word of the Lord to you all, if you do not witness the resurrection of the seed of God in you in your life time to make you clean, and if ye are not made clean by it; if you are not become a new lump; if you are not new Creatures; if old things be not past away, and all things become new, you are not the plants of God; you are not branches of the true vine, and so you belong not unto Christ; saith he, I am the vine, ye are the branches, and every branch in me that bringeth forth fruit my Father purgeth it, that it may bring forth more fruit; now
ye are clean! through the word which I have spoken unto you, abide in me, and J in you; as the branch cannot bear fruit of it self, except it abide in the vine, no more can ye, except ye abide in me. But if you cannot withess the feed of GOD, which hath made you of one and the same Nature wich Christ, you are unclean; and if you are not made clean here, and if you do not walke with Christ in the regeneration of life here, you shall never raigne with him in glory hereafter.

Therefore in the feare of the living God, take heed to, and stand fast in that which is your strength, which is a measure of that which is eternall of God, which is sufficient, if improved to bring you to the dawning of a perfect day, and into a perfect estate in Christ as I have said, but if a man abide not in his measure but goe forth from that of God in him which is pure and is his present power against sin, then hee goes from that which should preserve him. If a man abide not in me saith Christ, he is cast forth as a Branch and is withered, and men gather them and cast them into the fire and they are burned; and this is that which the stoutest of you must come to witness, yea the stout stubborne nature must be judg'd out, and the wilde branches cut off, and cut downe they must not cumber the ground.

Therefore consider what I say all you that are imitating the Saints in Praying, Preaching, Dipping, and breaking of Bread and talking of the Scriptures of truth, in your falne wisdome in your first Natures living in pride and wantonness, making provision for the flesh to fulfill the lusts thereof, why? This is the word of the Lord God to you all, you are unfruitfull branches, and the best of your fruit is accursed, and you must be cut downe to the ground; yea Gods hewers are gone out, and the axe is laid unto the root of the Tree! therefore every tree, which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewen downe and cast into the fire, yea all that are in the forme out of the life are for the fire; and all your performances, are as Tinne, wood, hay, and stubble, and the day is approaching that every mans works shall be made manifest, for the day shall declare it because it shall be revealed by Fire, and the fire shall try every mans worke of what sort it is, 1 Cor. 3.13.

Therefore to the light all come, and submit to it and it will let you s •• the judgment feat, and bring you to the tryed Stone, upon
which venture to fall as I have said, that you may be broken, for if it fall upon you, it will grind you to powder; for to the judgment seat must all come before ever you shall be permitted to come to the Mercy seat, and the fire of the Lord you must all feel and submit to; and whosoever thou art if thou hast not felt the fire of the Lord, thou art uncleane and yet in thy sins: and the Lord JESVS CHRIST, thou dost not know, though thou art talking of him, but who may abide the day of his coming, and who shall stand when he appeareth; for hee is like a Refiners fire and like Fullers sope, and he shall sit as a refiner, and purifier of Silver, and he shall purifie the Sonnes of Levi and purge them as Gold and Silver that they may offer unto the Lord an offering in righteousness, Malac. 3.2. (Marke that) An offering offered after burning, after a passing through the fire.

Yea and this is the word of the Lord to all that have cares to heare, that no offering the Lord accepts of at your hands till you can witness a cleansing by fire; and this and being made cleane by the word is one and the same; for is not my word like fire saith the Lord, and like a hammer that breakes the Rockes in pieces: yea, and this is a mercy to all that can witness it, and those that do not come to witness this, to witness the judgement Seat with in, in every particular and that which is contrary to God to be judg'd out, yea and all the works of the Divell to be destroyed, and Esaus nature judg'd out and consumed, by the fire of the Lord; if thou harboureft and keepest a live, any of the uncircumcised, that is; if thou harbourest any one lust in thy heart, that the Sword and the fire of the Lord, hath not cut down and burnt up; if the seed of God be yet burthened, if the enmity be yet remaining, and Esaus nature yet living, then thou doest harbour that which is for the fire, and the Sword, and then thou must looke for the terrible day of the Lord to come upon thee, and upon all that have done as thou hast done, that is to keepe that in the house, which is to be cast out and to spare and to keep alive that which is for the sword and for death; yea in so doing thou dost reape Gods displeasure; and what remaines but a certaine fearfull looking for of judgment and fiery indignation which shall devour the adversaries, Heb. 10.27. And it is a fearefull thing to fall into the hands of the living GOD.

But who may abide the day of his comming and who shall stand when he appeares as aforesaid, why? The hypocrite shall not be able to stand in judgment nor the wicked cannot stand in the Congregation of the righteous when Christ shall arise and appeare terribly to shake the earch, nay no flesh shall be able to stand when he appeareth; The proud Boaster, he that hath stole the true Prophets words, and beares them; who is out of the life of God, in the exaltation exalted in his fleshly wisdome, shall be fuell for the fire, and shall be even as chasse and stubble before the wind; for behold the day commeth that shall burne as an Oven, and all the Proud, and all that doe wickedly shall be as stubble, and the day that cometh shall burne them up, saith the Lord of hoasts, that it shall leave them neither root nor branch, for hee shall sit as a refiner and purifier of Silver, and hee shall purifie the Sons of Levi, and purge them as Gold and Silver, that they may offer unto the Lord an offering in Righteousness.

Now mind that (birth) which offereth an offering in righteousness, it was and is that which had and hath passed through the fire, it is that which was pure of God which the fire could not destroy, nor the flames thereof take hold, and this is a pleasant offering unto the Lord as in the dayes of old; and as in the former yeares and here is the Scripture fulfilled, where it saith, And I will come neere to you to judgment, and J will be a swift witnesse against the Sorcerers and against the Adulterers and against false Swear • rs, and against those that oppresse the hireling of his wages; the Widow and the Fatherless, and that turne aside the Stranger from his right, and feare not me saith the Lord of hosts, Malac. 3.5.

Therefore I say mind the light that you may come to be led and guided by it, that so you may come to know the judgment Seat of CHRIST, and to witness a cleansing; and that so you may not be condemned with the world in that terrible day of Gods separation, when he shall plead with all Flesh; and seperate the Sheepe from the Goates; therefore, know the day of your visitation; for thus saith the Lord, My Spirit shall not alwayes strive with man: There is a time that God doth strive with man, and there is a time, when hee will no longer strive with man.

Therefore I say know the day of your visitation and harden not
