your hearts against the Light which moveth in you against Sin and would not that any should perish; and verily, I could wish that you did know the day of your visitation, yea the things that belong to your everlasting Peace, before they are hid from your eyes, for there is a terrible day a coming wherein God will plead with all Flesh, with all those that are enemies to (and opposers of) his light and flight the day of his love, and have not on the wedding Garment but have trusted unto and are found in the shadow of things without life, in a forme of godliness, without the power: remember what is (written) and the (King) came in to see the Guests and hee saw a man that had not on the wedding garment, and he said unto him (friend) how camest thou in hither not having on the wedding garment, and hee was (Speechless;) and verily this will be your conditions, when the Lord shall appeare; yea I say this will be your conditions, who are from the light worshipping in your owne wills, and professing the Scriptures and talking of the Saints conditions, but are found out of the life of God, and in the life and way of the world, following the fashions thereof; as I have said, sporting your selves in the vaine exercises thereof, and are not come, to yea and nay as I have said, nor to witness a bridle to your tongues, but are naming the name of CHRIST and are not departed from iniquity.

And this is the word of the Lord to you all, against such will he come in slaming fire taking vengeance on them that know not God and that obey not the Gospell of our Lord Iesus Christ; who shall be punished with everlasting destruction, from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of his power, when he shall come to be glorified in his Saints, and to be admired in all them that believe; because our testimony among you was believed in that day, 2 Thes. 1.8.

And this let all those Baptiss, and all those who were of other Sects, who are gone out from that of God in them, which is pure; which once moved in them against sin, and are become Ranters and have made shipwrack of Faith and a good Conscience, & have turned from the grace of God into wantonness; why let all such know, that though they have given up themselves, to worke wickedness, and in the hardness of their hearts, are filling up the measure of their iniquities; and though they are growne into such a
grosse infidelity as not to thinke that there is a GOD, that will take vengeance on the wicked; why? this is the word of the Lord, to you also, and this know that the Lord will come in a day that you thinke not of, and in an houre when as you are not aware, and cut you asunder, and give you your portions with the hypocrites there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth; yea verily and this know, that the Lord doth not delay his coming; nor hee is not flacke concerning his promise (as some men count flackness) but is long suffering to us-ward, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to Repentance; but the day of the Lord will come, as a Thiefe in the night, in the which the heavens shall passe away, with a great noise, and the Elements shall melt, with fervent heat; the earth also (and the workes that are therein) shall be burnt up: And saith the Apostle, Seeing then, that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought ye to be, in all holy conversation and godliness, looking for, and hastening unto the comming of the day of GOD, wherein the heavens being on fire shall be dissolved, and the Elements shall melt with fervent heat, 2 Pet. 3.9.

But say you who are called Anabaptists, who are from the light and guidance of the Spirit of CHRIST, setled upon the lees in a dead formality without life; Say you no man can be perfect here; and upon the ninth of the tenth moneth upon the Guard in the Muse before severall of the Souldiery did deny that God hath given a measure of his Light which is infallible, and eternall, for every man to profit withall; and to which I shall not speake much to now, because J have sufficiently proved it (in my former discourse) as all that doe believe will beare me witness, to which Light I doe once againe in the feare and dread of the Lord exhort you to take heed to, that you may be led and guided out of the broad way of the world which leadeth to destruction: death and darknesse; into the strait way of CHRIST which is Life eternal to know; and those that abide in it shall never come into the condemnation of the wicked, in which state all stand that are from the
light of CHRIST; which lighteth every man, that commeth into the world: and out of this state doe none come but they that are led and guided by the Light; for he, that walketh in darknesse knowes not whither hee goes; and therefore saith CHRIST, walke while you have the Light, and it is very ridiculous to me, that you or any other, should call your selves the Church of CHRIST, and yet deny the light of Christ: Why vaid the Apostle to the Church, Yee are the children of the day, you are not of the night, nor of darknesse: and so you that deny the Light must needs be in darknesse untill now.

And now let him that readeth, understand what my discourse all along, in this little Treatise tends to, and points at (which is this) That the light which comes from Christ, leads to Christ: who is the sure foundation, upon which whosoever buildeth abides for ever: But you that dis-owne the Light of CHRIST which is infallible, and eternall, and which leads to the sure foundation, to the rocke of Ages; why? I say you are blind and walke in darknesse, and know not whither yee goe, and remaine ignorant of the sure word of Prophesie; which is as a Light that shiues in a darke place, though great talkers of it: and this is the word of the Lord GOD to you all and to all people under heaven, that whosoever disowneth the Light of Christ which is eternall, and cannot witnesse a measure of it in them, wherewith they are led and guided, are led by the Prince, of the power of the ayre, which ruleth in the hearts of the Children of disobedience, and CHRIST JESVS who is the way, the truth and the Life you have not knowne, nay you have not seene his Starre, and so you know not the Manger wherein the Babe lyes, and so are looking for Christ a-farre off and are looking for him above the Starres (as I have said) and to come in the Clouds without you, where as hee is come in the clouds within you, but being from the Light which leads to him you see him not, nor know him not when as hee is talking with you.

Now that you may know him, and grow into acquaintance with him, this is he, that was, and is, and is to come, by whom the world was made; and without him was not any thing made that was made; and (I say) this is he that is talking in you, in the bed wherein you lie, and upon the road as you ride, and in the way when you walk: (As thus) consider Thou that art a covetous man, is not there something in thee? that tells thee that covetousness is a sin? and thou that art a drunkard, is not there something in thee, that tels thee drunkenness is a sin: and art thou not convinced in thy self, and sorely troubled at it? Sometimes insomuch, that thou breakest forth into words, though thou doest but takes God name in vain: Yet I say, thou wilt sometimes say, Lord have mercy upon thee, what a wicked wretch sayest thou have I been, to thus offend God as I have done? Why this which moveth in thee against drunkenness is Christ: yea it is he that is talking with thee. And so let the unclean person, the adulterer, and the sweater, and him that forsweareth, and the deceitfull person, consider that which moveth in you against uncleanness, and against swearing, and forswearing, and against your deceit; this is the Light, this is Christ! that is talking with you; and would not that any should perish in their sins, as I have said: And this (I say) is Christ, be ye acquainted with him; for this is he that said, I go away to him that sent me, and whither I go, you cannot come: but saith he, I will see you again, and I will come and receive you unto my self that where I am, there ye may be also: And saith he who is the Light of the world, it is expedient that I go away, but I will send the Comforter unto you, even the Spirit of Truth, which shall lead you into all truth: whom the world cannot receive, because they see him not.

And now this I have declared, for your sakes who are called Anabaptists, that if by any means I might bring you to the acquaintance with Christ to be guided by his Light, that so in time you might come to feel his life, and to witness Gods treasure in you, and to know the pure separation in every particular, and to come to the perfect state, which as yet you oppose and say, How can this be? nay say you, In many things we sin all: And whon we have done all that we can, we are unprofitable servants. And
this I could not but put you in minde of, as being spoken by some of you upon the Guard in the Muse, the ninth of the tenth month, 1657.

To which I answer, owning the Scriptures of truth, and do not deny, but that James did say, In many things we sin all; and indeed this place of James is fulfilled in you that are Baptists, who are from the light and guidance of the Spirit; out of the one Thing, out of Christ, out of that wherein union standeth, and so are in the many things: lo here, and lo there, lo this, and lo that, in strife about words; in the vain janglings; and so in the many things you sinne All: being (I say) from the Light, which leads into Christ, into the one Thing and so your performances standing in your own wills, out of the Light, Life, and Power of GOD, and so in all things that you do, you are unprofitable Servants.

And now I cannot say that any man is perfect in himself, (nay) but in Christ Jesus, you that were sometimes afar off are made nigh, by his blood, through the sanctification of the Spirit, and belief of the Truth: and saith Paul, We preach to present all men perfect in Christ, but out of Christ there is no perfection: It is the Spirit that quickeneth, the flesh profiteth nothing: But this know, that if you are not washed, if ye are not sanctified and justified in the name of the Lord Iesus, and by the Spirit of our God then are ye an imperfect birth, and unlike the Church of God, and are such that shall not enter into the Kingdom of God, 1 Cor. 6.11. and in the 16. verse saith he, What know ye not? that he which is joyned to an harlot, is one body, for two, saith he, shall be one flesh, but he that is joyned to the Lord is one Spirit; and so you carnal Professors, who cannot witness the Spirit of Christ dwelling in you cannot be clean nor perfect: and so you judge being from the Light that should let you see, that the Church of God was, and is, like unto you, even unclean, which is blasphemy to affirm; as I confess it were blasphemy, for any to affirm that any man since the Fall, as he stands in his first nature to be perfect. Nay, there is no perfection but in Christ: I in them, saith Christ, to his Father, and thou in me, that they may be made perfect in one, Ioh. 17.23. And in him saith the Apostle, Ye are compleat,
who is the head of all principalities and powers: which Doctrine of perfection was first taught by Christ to his Disciples, saith he, Be ye perfect, as your heavenly Father is perfect, Mat. 5.48. But you carnal Anabaptists are ignorant of a perfect state in Christ, and deny that there is any Scripture for it: yet besides what I have proved in my former Discourse, and because you deny that there is any Scripture that speaketh of a measure of the gift of God which is eternal, read 2 Cor. 12.7. where you may see that Paul had a measure, and he speaketh of a measure of the grace of God; and saith he, Least I should be exalted above measure, through the abundance of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, the messenger of Satan to buffet me, least I should be exalted above measure: and so in the Ephesians, Ephes. 4.6. One Lord, one faith, one baptism one God and Father of all who is above all, and through all and in you all; but unto every one of us is given grace, according to the measure of the gift of Christ: Wherefore he saith, When he ascended up on high, he led captivity captive, and gave gifts unto men. And in ver. 11. saith he, He gave some Apostles, and some Prophets, and some Evangelists, and some Pastors, and Teachers, for the perfecting of the Saints; for the work of the Ministery, for the edifying of the body of Christ, till we all come in the unity of the faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ.

And now oh deceived Spirits! read and confess your ignorance, who say, that the Church of God is not perfect, Phillip. 3.15. saith the Apostle, Let us therefore as many as be perfect be thus minded: And Paul prayed to God, that through the blood of the ever lasting Covenant, they might be made perfect in every good work to do his will, Heb. 13.20, 21. Now see your blindness, to which end, I put you in minde of these places of Scripture, 1 Pet. 5.10. But the God of all grace who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle you, to him be glory and dominion for ever and ever Amen: and saith he, Leaving the principles of the doctrine of Christ let us go on to perfection. Heb. 6.1. But this I say again, that there is no perfection
but in Christ, and he whose Faith stands in the power of God, stands in that which is perfect; therefore turn your minds to the Light, and know your measures, and know that all men have a measure given them to profit withal: but the measure of Faith you have not received, because you have not believed, but are from the measure of light, which shineth in darkness, and your darkness comprehendeth it not. We read of a measure of Faith, saith he, as God hath dealt to every man a measure of Faith: and there is a measure of light, and the least measure of light, or the least measure of Faith, that God gives is perfect: and whosoever abides faithful in his measure, and yields obedience to that of God in him (as I have said) will bring him to the dawning of a perfect day, and into a perfect state in Christ; and as every one stands, single in his measure, given of God, he stands in the power of God, but those that go out into the many things (as I have said) go out from the power of God, and feel not the life of God; and those that feel not the life of God, feel the life of the world; and they that live in a state of wantonness, feel the life of the Prince of the power of the ayr, and are guided by the spirit, that ruleth in the children of disobedience: And this is your condition who live in wantonness, and bring Scripture to plead for sin, and against perfection: and so (as I have said) the best of your fruit is of God accursed. But oh Fools! and slow of heart, to believe all that the Prophets have said!

AND now Reader in the fear and dread of the living God of life and power and righteousness, and in soberness, in the cool of the day, and in the light of Christ which lighteth every man that cometh into the world, weigh what thou hast read in the true balance of equity, and be not too hasty, nor to rash, to judge; but in the light of Christ wait to have things opened in thee, and
made plain to thee; for g • eat is the mysterie of Godliness, God manifested in the flesh; and verily unless thou come solemnly to wait in the light, which manifesteth sin, and evil in thee, thou canst not know the things of God. For the things of the Spirit of God are not known nor understood, but in the Light: for those that are gone out from the Light, who cannot witness a stay to their minds, they know not the mysterie of godliness, neither are they godly; but are out of the godly state: for godliness doth not consist in words but in righteousness, and peace, and joy in the holy Ghost. Nay the Hypocrite can come, and is come so far; and all the world is come so far, as to have words, and to talk what the Prophets said, and what the Apostles and other Believers said, and to imitate them, as touching the outward Form: but godliness is something else, and a godly state is something more. It is such a state that the Hypocrite is not in, though the Hypocrite be much in the imitation of the Saints, and true Servants of God, much in hearing, and reading, and often naming the name of Jesus, and talking of the worship of God; yet they know not the true worship, which is in spirit and in truth; they know not the Fathers house, but they and their worship is without the Gate, in the Court, without the Temple, which is no more to be measured; but is for the winepress of the wrath of GOD, and to be trodden under foot: yea so it is written, the wine press was trodden without the City.

And now Reader thou that thinkest the Anabaptists (so called) are so wel-sayoured, because they are in the imitation of the Church of God, as for water-baptism, bread, and wine, and such like (outward things) in which there is no life: yet if thou come seriously to weigh things in the light, thou mayst see that I have not wronged them at all, in comparing them to one of those many heads and horns of the Beast: for they are a Beast of themselves with many horns; for they are divided and grown out into several heads; one of one opinion, and another of the other opinion, and so are divide into several Sects and opinions, and are worshipping in several bodies, the one pushing at the other, and against the other, but all against the Light which manifesteth sin and evil, and these make one absolute Beast with several heads and horns.

And you Baptists have manifested your selves to be a Beast, and of a beastly power, in denying the Light of CHRIST and the measure of Gods eternall Spirit, to be your Teacher and guide; No longer then the 28. of the tenth Moneth, 1657. in the night upon the Guard in Pauls that great Cathedrell, when as I was reproving the Souldiers for sin in the power of God, and directing them to the light of CHRIST, and to take heed to it, as a measure given to them and to every one to profit withall, which if minded and obeyed, would bring to the dawning of the perfect day, and into a perfect state in Christ as I have said; and to witnesse the power of God made manifest, which cleanseth the heart and sets free from sin all that believe and abide in it.

But John Mercer did oppose me and deny there is any such thing, as a measure from God received, or to be received, and made manifest in the Sons of men; but saith it is a new coined word, and that which the Scriptures are silent in, and mention not, by which he manifested himself, to be of the beastly power and an opposer of the Truth; For that there is a measure of the eternall Spirit of God which the Saints of old did witnesse; and which the Saints now gathered, doe witnesse, to be our Teacher and Guide, and by it we are led into all Truth: And Iohn Mercer and all others who deny, and cannot witness a measure of the same Spirit to lead and guide them, they are led and guided by the God of this world, by the Prince of the power of the ayre, which ruleth in the hearts of the Children of Disobedience as the Scripture doth declare.

And so now Reader, in the feare of the Lord read over this little Treatise againe, and thou mayst see it made plaine by the Scriptures, that those which deny the Light of Christ and a measure of God made manifest in them that they have not, as yet, learned Christ, who cannot witness his Power made manifest in them: neither have they received Christ, though great talkers of him; For as many as received him, to them hee gave power to become the Sonnes of GOD! even to as many as believe 〈◊〉 his Name: (Marke this) to as many as received him, to them! hee gave power, and marke the word (Power) they that received him received power, and so it is plaine
they that are sons have power from God, and power in God to prevail with God, and power over the world, the flesh and the devil.

And now to say that all men have a measure from God is no new thing, nor new coined word as John Mercer saith; but John Mercer, and all others; that deny a measure of the eternal Spirit of the Father, to lead and to guide them, are the slothfull and unprofitable servants, who have • id their talent in the earth, and must give an account thereof, when the Good man of the house shall return, he that hath an ear to hear let him hear. And what I say to one I say to all, what I say to Souldiers I say to Officers, Watch, for ye know not what hour the Lord will come, whether at midnight, or at the Cock crowing, or at the dawning of the day, or in the morning.

Therefore in the fear of the Lord, confider what you are a doing, you that are in the vain disputes about Religion, and you mad Souldiers and foolish Officers, who spend most of your time upon the Guard in wantonness, madness and folly; for the Lord will come as a chief in the night (as I have said, and as it written) and cut all them asunder, and give them their portions with hypocrites, who are not found in a measure of that which is eternal of God in them; to be their guide as I have said; you that are from the light, from that of God in you, which is pure, which consents not to sin; you that have slain Gods witness, and have neglected Gods service, to serve the God of this world, the Prince of the powers of the ayr, that ruleth in the hearts of the children of disobedience; you that have not on the wedding garment, you that have not gained something by trading with that talent the Lord hath entrusted you withall: You that have not salt in your selves, you that do not savour something of God in you, you that are not found in some small measure of that which is pure of God; and you that have not some oyl in your vessels, whose Lamps are quite out, and burn not at all, shall not enter in with the Bridegroom when he cometh, but the door shall be shut against you, for you are foolish virgins. It is written, While the Bridegroom tatryed long they all slumbred and slept, and at midnight, there was 〈◊〉 made; Behold the Bridegroom cometh! Go ye out to meet him, and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage, and the door was shut.

Therefore in the fear of the Lord, and in the light of Christ, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world Arise and trim your Lamps, all you which sit down to eat, and rise up to play, and in a dead fromality do slumber and sleep, and let your lights be burning, that you may be in a readiness; for it is those alone that are found ready, that shall enter in with him; and the door shall be shut against all slothfull and unprofitable servants, and foolish virgins, that cannot witness a cleansing by a measure of Gods eternal Spirit, which sanctifieth, and justifieth all that are partakers of it.

And as for thee John Merc • r, and the rest of thy brethren, who denies and cannot witness a cleansing and a making clean the heart by the Spirit of the living God, you are in the Apostacy, and in the alienation from God, and so under the curse, and the wrath of God abides on you; and that this is your condition, thou hast made it manifest before many witnesses upon the Guard in Pauls in making thy self ignorant of what I meant by the light and life of Christ; and it doth appear, that thou and the rest of thy Brethren are strangers to the life of God, by your asking me what it is, or what I meant by the light and life of Christ; for no man knowes the power of God, but those and such only that are guided by it, nor none knows the Life of CHRIST, but those that feel it; for the Life is felt and witnessed, by those that possess it.

And now in vain do you call your selves the Church of Christ, who remain ignorant of the life of Christ; you may read your condition in the Scriptures of truth, as in Ephes. 2. and other places: and the Spirit excludes you, from being the Church of Christ, who cannot witness the life of Christ made manifest in you; for it is the Spirit that quickeneth, the flesh profiteth nothing: and now you that deny the light and life of Christ to be in you, worship in your own wills, and are the wil-worshippers, and such that are always learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth; and so I say in vam do you form, and conform; yea in vain do you profess Religion, and your hearts not made clean by the Spirit of the living God.

Yea verily, though your women should cast off their harlot-like
attire, and tear of their silver and gold lace, and go in modest apparel: And you that are men should forsake and come out of the fashion of the world into a plain dress; nay though you did speak the same things, and declare the same truth in words, which I hold forth in the name and power and wisdom of GOD, and your hearts not changed, and made clean by the Spirit of the living God, you are but unprofitable servants, and foolish virgins, as I have said, which shall not enter in with the Bridegroom, but shall be shut out, with a Go ye cursed, I know not whence you are; depart from me ye workers of iniquity, there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

And now what I have declared are words of truth, and of a • ound understanding to all that inherit substance: therefore in the fear of the Lord be silent, and cease from your vain bablings and disputings, and turn your minds inward to the light of Christ, which moveth in you, and in all men against sin, and wait ye for the promise of the Father, that you may come to have the Son revealed in you, that so you may come to witness the Seed, which the promise is to and to know a Birth born from above, which the gates of Hell shall not prevail against.

And now though many be the opposers of truth, and me and others, who do it declare; yet truth shall stand, and opposers shall fall, for truth is above them all, and over them all, and shall be a swift Witnesse against them all in the day of the Lord.

A word to my neighbour Anabaptists in the City and suburbs of London, who constantly call the days of the week, as received from the Heathen Authors, as Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday. Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, thus being from the light, ye are from the true language of the Scriptures, and from that Spirit which gave them forth, and this is another absurdity, as to call other days by such names as was given them by the Heathen Papists: As Christ-mass, Michael-mass, St. Andrews mass, and Candle-mass, and such like heathenish tearms; and you that are my neighbours do take offence at me, because I am come out of the practise of the Heathen (in which practise you yet stand) and because I cannot speak theirs and your Language, as to bid you God-morrow and God-den in the street, when I meet you, or as I
pass by your doors, you say it is a simple quality in me; and you think and say, that I am too sparing of my tongue; but I think, and know, and affirm, in the fear of the Lord, that you have too much tongue, and vainly speak, and wantonly speak, and paddle away your precious time, living in the lusts of the flesh, the lusts of the eye, and in the pride of life, which is not of the Father, but of the world.

So this is the word of the Lord to you all, whether you will hear or whether you will forbear. Whatsoever you perform in the worship of God, and not moved by a measure of Gods eternal Spirit thereunto is in your own wills; and whatsoever is done in your own wills, is not acceptable in the sight of God, but is Idolatry. And though you imitate the Prophets, Christ, and the Apostles, as I have said, and though you preach, pray, dip, and break bread, and not carried into it by the same Spirit, that raised Jesus Christ from the dead, it is Idolatry, and will not hide nor cover you from the wrath of God, in the day of his power. Therefore in the fear of the Lord be silent and wait in the light, which manifests sin and evil in you, that sin, and all the works of the devil may be destroyed, that there may be nothing remaining in you, but what is pure and of God.

Paul in his Epistle to the Corinthians did reprove some of them for being pussed up and exalted in their fleshly minds, who were gone out from that of God in them, which was pure, and said that he would nor know the speech of such, but their power, 1 Cor. 4.18. And this is your condition, who are called Anabaptists, you being erred from the Light, are gone out from that of GOD in you, which is pure, and so are in the Form, but out of the Life, puffed up in your fleshly wisdom, and so being from the light and guidance of the Spirit, are building up one another in the outward Tradition, and are talking of the Saints conditions, and are in the outward practice of such things, of such Institutions, or Ordinances, as you call them, which are Carnal, as Dipping, and breaking of Bread, and such like, and are very zealous therein: and will not own, nor joyn in worship with any, but such only that see with your carnal eyes, and understand the Scriptures as you understand them; and you call all those the World, whose Worship is contrary to yours,
though better then yours, yet you will go in their fashion in apparel, and strive to go beyond them in pride, calling it but decency; yea I say, though you differ from them in your carnall Worship, yet not in the carnal fashions of the world, though I say you dis-own their Worship, yet you do not disown their Fashions; as in pride of Apparel, and Feasting; and at your Feasts, and upon all other occasions, you are as full of idle and vain talkings, and foolish jestings, as any whom you call the World, which is not convenient, neither was it ever commendable among the Saints of God; but you being from the light and guidance of the Spirit, you are puffed up, and live in fleshly pleasures: So I disown the speech of all such when they talk of God and Christ, and make a profession of Religion, whose hearts are not washed and sprinkled from an evil conscience, but lives in the practice of the Heathens, whose language is one and the same with them, as I have said, who cannot witness a bridle to their tongues.

And this, not out of any prejudice, to any particular, but in soberness as moved of the Lord J have written and published to goe abroad in the Army City, and Country; that you which are called Anabaptists and all other Sects; who are the severall Heads and hornes of the Beasts, that are from the light in the forme but out of the Life: yea I say that you may all know the truth, and may be informed that God hath given a measure of his Light wherewith every man that cometh into the world is enlightened withall, and the least measure thereof, is an infallible guide, and is sufficient power against sin where it is minded and obeyed, to lead out of it; and out of the Divels kingdome, of Pride, and vaine glory, and out of the worlds wayes of worship which is Carnall, sensuall, and divelish; which stands in the enemity against the pure Light, and Spirit from whence the true declaration came, into the true worship which is in Spirit and in truth; which stands not in meats, nor drinkes nor in outward washings, nor outward observations of dayes, places and such like things, in which the Hypocrite dwels; who are erred from the light and stand in the enmity, and against God, and are out of the Life from the light, in that night of darknesse and Apostacie; which Christ prophesied should come, and is come upon the world, where as
no man could or can worke, hee that hath an Eare to heare let him heare, and understand, and turne to the light of CHRIST, which every one is lighted withall; which is the Fathers love to all, that none might abide in darknesse, and so perish: This I say is the love of GOD to all who would not that any one should perish, but would that all men should be saved and come to the knowledge of the truth: which makes free, and sets Free all that come to it, and in it abides; for it is written, if the truth shall make you free, you shall be free indeed, but if you harden your hearts and stiffen your neckes against the Light, which would if believed in, obeyed and followed, lead you to Christ the way, the truth, the Life; but I say if with your Hornes you push against it, you will abide in death and darknesse, in which state the wicked opposers of the Light, the Way, the Truth, and Life, goe to the grave accursed, from whence there is no redemption, nor resurrection to life, but a resurrection to condemnation.

And now take notice that I dis-owne you all, even the heads and chief Teachers or chiefe Disputants, who are degenerated from what you were, and have shewed your selvos, and made it manifest that you are one and the same, with the common Priests of the world, for as they oppose the way, the truth and life of God, so doe you and have gotten the very same arguments, which sheweth that you are of the very same Spirit with them, though differing from them in some circumstances; yet your discourse and arguments against the Light, and against the Saints how gathered, are of the very same nature as theirs are; but yet know, in the feare of the Lord, that no weapons formed against Christ his light, and way shall prosper. And now take notice I say that I disowne you all, and all your worship who are opposing the light of Christ, and making use of the Priest weapons, which I, and all the Children of light, doe detest against and against you all who are in the disputings, and in the vaine janglings, out of the Life, and from the Light erred, and from the Life alienated, and in a dead formality, setled upon the lees, who cannot witnesse a pure separation in every particular, but doe owne those for Brethren who are by the world (and by you who professe your selves the Church of Christ) scornfully called Quakers, and the heads thereof
of who are called, and chosen, and faithful Stewards of the manifold gifts and graces of God, who are set apart to teach and to watch over the souls of all those whom the Lord hath made them Instruments to gather, and to be overseers of: and I count, reckon, and esteem of them, as Fathers, who hath begotten me and others into a lively Faith in Christ Jesus, and have travelled in Birth with us, till Christ was formed in us: and now Fathers, and all the rest who are my beloved Brethren, this is the purpose and the intent of my heart, to watch, and to wait with you in the light of Christ, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world; yea, with you who are Fathers & Gods watchmen the true Ministers, Saints in light, will I wait in the Grace, given me of God, according to the measure of the gift of Christ, till with you, I come in the unity of the Faith, and of the knowledge of the Son of God, unto a perfect man, unto the measure of the stature of the fulness of Christ: yea, in my measure will I wait all the days of my appointed time, till my change come, knowing, that if our earthly house of this Tabernacle were dissolved we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens where we shall possess durable riches, and the crown of glory which sadeth not away, but is reserved for us, where moth doth not corrupt and where thieves cannot break through, nor steal: and this is the Faith and lively confidence of him, who is by Scorners, called the Quaking Souldier, but is known in the Army, and to his Countrymen, by the name of,
